loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh was born in 1976. She lives in Dan Di village. She is a member of Dan Di cluster. Her husband is a taxi driver. He has income. She has two children. Mrs Oanh has a restaurant. She sells breakfast. She has had this job for 4 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2010. The last time she borrowed 5,886,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy chairs and a desk for her restaurant. She is the leader of 7-member group loan in SEDA. 
 about other borrowers in her group loan:
 Tinh is 53 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to buy cloths to make curtains.
 Huong is 2 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to small business.
 Ha is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to expand her mobile shop.
 Lu is 35 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to buy pictures to sell.
 Suot is 60 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7.630.000 VND to small business.
 Yen is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy more grocery to sell.

loans.use: to buy chairs and a desk for her restaurant

loans.name: Kasanga Thuyikulhaye Group

texts.en: Gorretti is a thirty-seven year-old married woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goals are educating her children and building a permanent home.  She has been running a retail shop for four years, after starting with capital of five hundred thousand (UGX) only.  The main hardships are: price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However, she has goals of buying land to grow crops and of moving the business to a more permanent location. Gorretti needs the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.  One of the group members did not take the loan, but as per policy he had to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Swasembada 3 Group

texts.en:
Nuraini is pictured on the right wearing the brown veil. Nuraini is a widow. She is a mother of three children. Her children already finish school and have  jobs. She has been selling cosmetics for two and half years. Her business is going well. She can add more cosmetics step by step. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use it to buy different brands of cosmetics. She likes to do this business because cosmetics are durable and easy to sell. One problem that she usually faces is when it is raining, she needs to close her kiosk. That is why, in the future, she wants to have her own shop. So even though it is raining, she still can open her shop.

Other group members will use their part of the loan to improve their businesses such as selling vegetables and nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is a twenty-two-year-old, hardworking lady who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to buy a car, build a permanent house, and educate herself. She has been running a stationery shop for one year and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However, she has business goals of diversifying the business to include a restaurant, moving the business to a more permanent location, and expanding the business into new areas. The purpose of this loan is to buy a photocopier for her stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent residential house.  She has been running a phone accessories business for the last four years and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel costs, and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. However, she has goals of diversifying her business into a telecom company and hiring employees to help expand the business.The purpose of this loan is to buy phones and accessories to resell.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a 45-year old mother of five children. She has been selling charcoal for the last 11 years with great success.  

This is her third loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET to finance her business.  She plans to use the funds to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resell to the residents of Kilifi.  She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business further.  

She hopes to have a successful business and thus live a happier and more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Boris Carnot Dagobert

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, il se lance dans la vente d’huile en 2000  quand il arrête ses études en classe de terminale par manque de moyen.
Au commencement il avait la capacité de s’acheter seulement un a deux bidons d’huile  de 25 l, et depuis qu’il est client de Hope sa capacité d’achat a largement augmenter.
A l’octroi de ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en ajoutant 25 bidons de 25 l d’huile et 10 bidons de 25 l d'huile de palme, et après ses produits sont vendus en détail  auprès de ses potentiels clients.
Très pragmatique, il a une grande capacité de vente  et a pour projet d’ouvrir un grand dépôt d'huile  d’arachide et d’huile de palme.
texts.en:
Boris Carnot Dagobert, aged 38, is single and cares for two children. In 2000 he left school in his final year because he lacked financial resources, and began selling oil. In the beginning he could buy only 1 or 2 cans of oil of 25 liters, but when he became a client of the microfinance institution Hope S.A., his purchasing capacity increased substantially.

He will use this new loan to increase his inventory by buying 25 cans of oil of 25 liters and 10 cans of palm oil of 25 liters and then he will sell his merchandise to potential customers.

A very pragmatic man endowed with a great ability to sell, he plans to open a large warehouse of groundnut oil and palm oil.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and groundnut oil.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en:
Zephanous is a 42-year-old hardworking man with two children who lives in Kasese Uganda. For the past seven years, he has been operating a clothing shop. He started with 400,000 UGX in working capital and now has over 1,500,000 UGX. Zephanous's business hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. 

Zephanous is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business vision is to expand his business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 7 Group

texts.en:
Lisa is taking another loan from VisionFund Indonesia. The previous loan helped her to contribute income for her family and helped her husband. At this time, she wants to use her part of loan to pay for more cell phone minutes refills. When she sells food items, she tries to sell cell phone minute refills and have a lot of customers. 

Before, her group had four members, but now her group only has three members.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone minute refills to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 35-year-old man married to Naema, a 27-year-old lady. They have been blessed with three children: Melani, age 8, who is studying in the third grade of elementary school; Maichel, age 5, who is attending kindergarten and Pricilia, age 4. 

To cover their daily needs, Simon works as a fishmonger. He sells fish from one house to another. He used to work as a public minivan driver for 10 years but he then resigned from the job and decided to be a fishmonger three years ago. Simon usually wakes up at 4 am to buy fresh fish from the fisherman and then resells them to his customers.

Simon realizes that he cannot survive with his current business because sometimes in rainy season he has difficulties getting fish from the market. Therefore, Simon is thinking of trying another business: raising pigs and reselling them to the pork traders. Simon is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. He wants to spend the loan on two pigs to be fattened. He hopes that his loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire sans enfant, elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais, il y a bientôt 10 ans,quand elle divorce avec son mari, Avec un  peu d'argent,  elle avait commence a vendre au marche  sur un étalage.
 Elle a deja beneficiee de 3 cycles de prêts a Hope, au premier prêt , elle achète des cartons de viande de bœuf des cotes de porcs , et a l'heure actuelle avec ce nouveau prêt , elle a encore doublée son stock de vivres frais en ajoutant 10 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 10 cartons de cotes de porc, 5 cartons de tripes et 5 cartons de viande de bœuf, elle a une capacité de vente de 15 a 25 cartons par jour  
Elle est une bonne cliente, elle a toujours bien remboursée et a fait des épargnes considérables .
Elle a des très bonnes  ambitions et  elle a pour  projet d'acheter son propre chambre froide  et devenir une grossiste
texts.en:
This customer, who is 48 years old, single and has no children, began selling fresh food almost ten years ago, when she got divorced from her husband. With a little money she began selling on a stall in the market. She has already had three loans from Hope: with the first loan she bought cartons of beef and pork ribs and with this new loan she has again doubled her stock of fresh food buy adding ten cartons of chicken legs, ten cartons of pork ribs, five cartons of tripe and five cartons of beef. She has the capacity to sell between 15 and 25 cartons a day.

She is a good customer and has always repaid her loans and made considerable savings. She has a lot of ambition and her plan is to buy her own cold room and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cartons of ribs, tripe and chicken legs

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 26 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables in Kilifi and she is doing great. 

Riziki is requesting for a second loan from KADET to purchase more cabbages, kales, onions, oranges, bananas, and tomatoes for sale. She will use the profits to educate her children and further expand her business

She hopes to expand her business and   and live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter

loans.name: Ranan

texts.en:
Ranan is 36 years old and married. She is from Al Hussein, Amman; Jordan. Ranan is making handmade masterpieces and rugs and operating from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase raw materials needed to make rugs.

Ranan is looking to expand her home-based project by networking with other countries such as Libya since she used to live there.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handmade rugs

loans.name: Yvette Florentine

texts.fr:
Client de 46 ans, mariée avec deux enfants, elle se lance dans la vente des poulets a bouillir en 2000, quand elle prend conscience des difficultés de sa famille pour aider son mari, elle loue une table au marche et acheté quelques cartons de poulets pour commencer.

A l'heure actuelle a deja bénéficié de 4 cycles de prêts, son commerce a largement évolué , sa capacité d'achat a largement augmente , elle a aussi la capacité de faire des stocks une fois par semaine, et ne prend plus a crédit.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va s'approvisionner en poulets,continuer a vendre en détails en demi gros sa marchandise, elle vend pour toutes catégories des clients, chacun trouve son compte chez elle.

Pour l'avenir, elle est entrain d'épargner parce-que avec ses benefices  , elle pense ouvrir une chambre froide pour faire la vente en gros et ensemble avec son mari, ils ont acheté une parcelle de  terrain et sont entrain de construire leur propre maison.
texts.en:
This client is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She started selling stewing chickens in 2000 when she became aware of the difficulties her family faced and decided to help her husband.  She rented a table in the market and bought some boxes of chicken to start out.

The client has been through four loan cycles, her business has made good progress, her purchasing power has increased, and she also has the ability to stock up once a week.  She no longer buys on credit.

With this new loan, the client will stock up with chickens.  She will continue to sell her merchandise retail and wholesale direct to the public.  She sells to all categories of customer.  Each one finds something with her.

The client is saving up for the future because she plans to use her profits to open a cold storage room so that she can sell wholesale.  She and her  husband have bought a plot of land and they are in the process of building their own home.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken meat

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 24 years old and married with two children. For the past five years, he has been a carpenter in Kilifi and is doing great. 

He is requesting his second loan from KADET ltd  to purchase new hammers, nails, and chisels for his carpentry workshop. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 

His hopes are to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase hammers, nails, and chisels

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is 34 years old and a mother with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a security employee at a local college who earns a decent salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past 15 years, Mervat's husband has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Mervat is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Mervat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and improve the herd

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Taghreed is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Taghreed's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old, married to Penninah, and has children.  He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last nine years with a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Thomas is requesting a fourth loan with KADET for KES 100,000 to purchase a dairy cow and feeds.  With the anticipated profits he plans to expand his business and repay his loan.

His hope is to fully venture into dairy farming and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jean Didier

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et  père de 5 enfants dont trois sont encore sur le banc de l’école. Il ouvre une alimentation il y’a de cela 20 ans, quand il finit ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouve du travail, il ouvre une alimentation pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts  et avec ce nouveau prêt, il va s’approvisionner de nouveau en renforçant le stock des denrées comme les sacs de lait en poudre, sacs de sucre, du riz, des bidons d’huile, cartons de conserves  et de la boisson importée comme des bouteilles de liqueur , whisky, des bières importées.
Sa stratégie est de vendre moins cher et avoir des produits des bonnes qualités, a l’avenir il tient a continuer dans le même sens, avoir une grande boutique pour continuer a prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Didier, age 51, is married and the father of five children, out of whom three still go to school. After finishing his university studies, twenty years ago, he opened a grocery store to provide for his family, since he couldn't find a job.

He already benefited from several loans, and he will use this one to resupply and bolster his stock of products, such as bags of powdered milk, bags of sugar, rice, cans of oil, boxes of canned food, and imported beverages such as liquor, whisky, and beers.

His strategy consists in selling at a lower price and carrying good quality products. In the future, he wants to continue in this direction, and have a large store to continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, sugar, rice, oil, canned food, liquor, whisky, and beers

loans.name: Marie Clementine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 53 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants dont tous sont maries, elle ouvre une alimentation , il y'a de cela trois ans, quand elle prend sa retraite et pour subvenir a ses besoins , elle ouvre une boutique d'alimentation.
Elle connait un grand succès depuis qu'elle s'est lancée dans cette voie, dans sa boutique on trouve un peu de tout , les gens ne vend plus loin pour s' approvisionner, des ces differents prêts, elle a agrandi son commerce,et elle a eu a faire des repayements avec beaucoup de régularités et  et avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va encore s'approvisionner en produits de premières nécessités comme des cartons de lait en poudre, de lait concentre, des boites de conserves comme des cartons des sardines,des cartons de corned-beef, des macédoines, mais doux,champignons,des sacs de farines, sacs de sucre et des bidons d'huile.

Tres entreprenante, elle tient a aller loin avec son projet, agrandir son magasin dans peu de temps  et continuer jusqu'à ce qu'elle ouvre une autre boutique dans un autre quartier.
texts.en:
Marie Clementine, age 53, is single with two married children. Three years ago, she opened a grocery store when she retired. She's been having a lot of success since she started in this field. In her store, one can find a bit of everything, and people comes from afar to purchase her products.

Thanks to her various loans, she was able to expand her business. She repaid her loans with great regularity, and she will use this new loan to resupply her stock of food staples, such as boxes of powdered and condensed milk, canned food, sardines, corned-beef, macedonia, sweet corn, mushrooms, sacks of flour and sugar, and cans of oil. 

Very entrepreneurial, she wants to go a long way with her project: rapidly expand her store and business, until she's able to open a new store in a different neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy food staples (milk, flour, sugar, oil, etc)

loans.name: Patricia Modestine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 40 ans, commerçante depuis bientôt 3 ans, quand elle réussit a son bac, ne voulant pas aller a l'université,avec ses économies , elle ouvre un magasin d'alimentation ou elle vend un peu de tout , conserves, pâtes alimentaires , savons, produits de lessives, bidon d'huile, sac de sucre et de farine...

Il y'a maintenant une année , elle est cliente de Hope, a l'octroi de ses prêts , elle ne pense qu'a renforcer le stock des marchandises de son magasin,avec ce nouveau prêt elle a fait autant en ajoutant dix bidons d'huile, 20 sacs de farine, des cartons de conserves et des cartons de savons de lessive ..
Tres ambitieuse , elle tient a aller loin et a l'intention de d'être une grande importatrice des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 40-year-old woman who became a merchant nearly three years ago. Rather than attend university after completing her bachelor’s degree, she opted to use her savings to open a grocery store where she sells a little of everything including canned goods, pasta, soap, laundry detergent, oil, sugar, flour, etc. 

She became a member of Hope a year ago and has been using her credits to replenish her stock of merchandise. With this new loan, she plans to do the same by purchasing 10 jugs of oil, 20 sacks of sugar, cartons of canned goods, and boxes of laundry detergent.

Very ambitious and determined to be successful, she plans to become a major importer of food products.

loans.use: to buy pasta, oil, sugar, canned goods, and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad, who is a 25-year-old young man, is a father for two daughters. He is a construction worker with a decent salary. 

In order to increase his family income and to improve their standards of living, Fouad has been raising sheep for 5 years. He wants to increase the number of sheep he is raising in order to increase his sales from their products and so increase his income. But since his decent salary he gets from working in construction isn't enough to cover the purchase of sheep and fodder, he needs to take a loan from FATEN for 1,500 USD. Getting this loan will enable Fouad to purchase more sheep and fodder and so increase his sales from their products which will lead to increased income. That will enable Fouad to create better living conditions for his family. Fouad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more numbers of sheep and fodder

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 29-year-old, hardworking lady with 4 children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. She has been selling charcoal for the last 4 years. She started with capital of 100,000 UGX and now has over 1,000,000 UGX as working capital. Her major hardship is customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of hiring employees to help expand her business. The purpose of the loan is to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Gaelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans avec 4 enfants, elle se lance dans le commerce il ya de cela 7 ans quand elle reconsidère les charges de sa famille, donc pour aider sa famille , elle achète des sacs,valises  pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
ayant deja beneficiee de plusieurs prêts auprès de Hope, c'est une cliente modèle qui a rembourse sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.Elle a des bonnes stratégies de vente,fournir des meilleurs produits et des meilleurs prix a ses clients.
Pour ce quartrieme  cycle prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des séries des sacs, des valises, des cartables a Kinshasa et fait des commandes en Chine pour satisfaire ses potentiels clients.

Dans l'avenir, elle a le projet d'ouvrir une bagagerie ou l'on trouvera tous les models de sacs et cartables et elle fera la vente en gros et en détail.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of four children. Due to the extent of the household expenses, she became a merchant seven years ago as a means of helping her husband. She buys and sells bags and suitcases to help support her family. 

A model member of Hope, she has already obtained several loans, which she repaid without difficulty. She also accumulated substantial savings. She relies on good sales strategies to provide her customers with better merchandise at better prices. 

She will use this 4th loan to increase her stock of bags, suitcases, satchels, etc. in Kinshasa. She will also place orders in China to meet the needs of potential customers.

In the future, she plans to open a store offering all types of bags and satchels at retail and wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bags, suitcases, satchels, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 32-year-old, secondhand clothes seller in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is single. He has been successfully running this business for the past 6 months.

 Ali was recently introduced to KADET and this marks his first loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase more bales of secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts. He will use the proceeds to repay his loan and buy more stock of clothes for his business.

He hopes to expand his business and and open a clothes boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Pasikazia

texts.en: Pasikazia is 56 years old, a widow with one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her child. She has been a trader in fresh foods for the last four years. The major business hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. However, she would like to diversify her business to include livestock farming. The purpose of this loan is to buy fresh foods for resale.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Cliente de de 44 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant , a l'arrêt de ses etudes en classe de terminale, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie en 2000. 
Ses potentiels  clients , les gens du quartier et les passants .Ayant deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts de Hope  elle va de nouveau prendre un autre prêt et renforcer la capacité de son activité en ajoutant des ballots  de marinières, des habits pour enfants et des adultes,  Elle rembourse ses prêts sans trop de difficultés et a des épargnes considérables.

Tres célèbre dans le quartier,elle tient a aller loin, elle s'occupe valablement de son foyer et aide a payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josephine is a 44 year old client. She is married and has one child. After her studies in secondary school, she began selling secondhand clothing in 2000. Her customers are people who live in the area and passersby.

Having already received several loans from Hope, she is now asking for another loan to grow her business by increasing her stock to include bundles of long-sleeved shirts as well as clothing for babys and adults. She pays back her loans without much difficulty, and she has considerable savings.

Very well known in her part of town, she wants to go far. She takes great care of her family and helps pays for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is  46 years old and mother of 3 children.  She rears poultry for sale in her locality Mshomoroni- Mombasa, She has been in business for the past six months with great success.  

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicken for rearing and resale.  She will use the proceeds to expand her business and to repay her loan. 
 Her hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale commercial poultry farming and to have a happy and prosperous family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old.  He is married to Elizabeth and together they have four children.  He is a welder and has been in business for 11 years.  He earns a monthly income of 49,000 KES.

Nelson is requesting his fourth loan with KADET in the amount of 45,000 KES.  He plans to use the loan to buy an additional welding machine.  He paid the previous loan well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET through a credit officer.

Nelson hopes to expand his business and improve his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy an additional welding machine.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti is 34 years old.  She is a hardworking lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

For the past nine years, Goretti has been selling clothes.  She began her business with 270,000 UGX in working capital and has expanded her working capital to 2,000,000 UGX.  The two major challenges she faces in her business are high fuel and transportation costs.  Goretti has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location in the future.  The purpose of this loan is to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 24 years old.  He is married and the father of one daughter.  He earns a decent salary as a partner in a DJ business for weddings and other occasions.  In addition, he has raised sheep for the past four years, selling their products to help him increase his income and provide better living conditions for his family. 

Khaled wants to purchase more sheep and install a new sheepfold, or enclosure, and is requesting a loan from FATEN in the amount of $2,000 to cover the expenses.  When Khaled receives the loan, he will purchase more sheep and install the sheepfold.  He hopes this will increase his sales of sheep products and so increase his income, which will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.  Khaled is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and install a sheepfold.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old. She is married to Peter and they have five children. She has been farming for the last 11 years and she earns a monthly income of Kes 9,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET,LTD. of KES15,000.  She will use the loan to buy more farming land. She was introduced to KADET, LTD. by a credit officer.

She hopes to expand her farming skills and venture into commercial farming.

loans.use: To buy more land for large-scale farming.

loans.name: Fayze

texts.en:
Fayze is a 28-year-old single lady from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Fayze is selling blankets, operating from her home, and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more blankets for resale.

Fayze is looking to expand her customer base and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets for resale.

loans.name: Sorofina

texts.en:
Sorofina  is a 51 year-old  and married . She has been selling charcoal for the last six years. Her monthly income from her business is kes 10,000. 

This is her first loan of Kes 20,000  from KADET ltd to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to the residents of Mshomoroni. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business more and repay her loan. 
Her hopes and dreams are to open charcoal distribution store to supply charcoal to other parts of  Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is 38 years old, married, and has four children. They live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a pub for one year. Her major hardships are high fuel and taxes.

Penninah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a refrigerator for use in her pub. In the future, she wants to diversify her business to include a hotel. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for use in her pub.

loans.name: Yeny Andrea

texts.es: Luchadora es la mejor palabra para describir a Yeny Andrea, una joven que a la edad de 18 años, ya tiene un hijo de 2 años, es madre soltera cabeza de familia y trabaja fuertemente para cubrir sus necesidades. Yeny Andrea trabaja por horas en un cultivo de flores cerca de su casa, y como independiente con unas vacas lecheras que tiene. La actividad de la crianza de las vacas lecheras la aprendió de su padre, quién siempre ha sido un gran apoyo para ella. Yeny Andrea sueña con poder tener su propia casa, su propio hogar y poder brindarle a su hijo todo lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Tenacious is the best word to describe Yeny Andrea.  She is an 18 year old young woman, and she has a two year old child.  She is a single mother and the head of the family.  She works very hard to cover their necessities.

Yeny Andrea works for hours cultivating flowers close to her house.  As an independent worker she has dairy cows.  She learned how to raise dairy cows from her father, who has always been a big support for her.

Yeny Andrea dreams of being able to have her own house and her own household.  She wants to be able to give her child everything that he needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Masaka Group

texts.en:
Fulgence is in his mid 30s and is single.  He has had a retail shop for five years.  He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Fulgence is requesting his seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to increase the shop inventory.  He used the previous loans to re-stock missing items in his retail shop and for household expenses; he has paid back all his loans successfully. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Fulgence will share this loan with his loan group "Masaka," which has a total of 15 members who hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.  He used his previous loan for the same purpose. 

Robert faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. He was able to save money and buy a motorcycle for transportation which has made his work easier. His dream is educating his children and owning a well stocked liquor store.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.name: Review-Mary Ngina

texts.en:
Mary Ngina is 51 years old and single. She runs a food stall in Mshomoroni, Mombasa and has been doing so for eight years. Her monthly income is 20,000 shillings. 

Mary Ngina is requesting her first loan from KADET, which she will use to purchase sufurias (pots), plates, serving dishes, and spoons. The anticipated profit will be used to further expand her business. She hopes to own a restaurant in the future..

loans.use: to purchase sufurias (pots), plates, serving dishes, and spoons.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en: Yeremiah is a hardworking man who lives in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. He has taken out previous loans and used them to buy goats to raise and sell. The main challenges he faces in this business are fluctuating prices, inflation and the high cost of labor. His goal is to open a second business which he can use to generate additional income for his family and pay for the education of his children. Yeremiah is applying for this loan to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: A sus 40 años, la señora Dora Maria es madre de tres hijos de 22, 16 y 5 años de edad por quienes trabaja día a día con el objetivo de poder brindarles lo que necesitan, dedicándose a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad con la cual puede conseguir los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia desde hace 10 años. Con el ánimo de aumentar su inventario para tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos, la señora Dora Maria necesita de la compra de mercancía tal como jeans, camisetas y ropa de niño que le permita cumplir su objetivo y a futuro poder tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora Maria, age 40, has three children; ages 22, 16, and 5.  It is for her children that she works day to day.  Her objective is to be able to give them what they need.

She sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes.  It is through this business activity that for the last ten years she has been able to get the income that is needed to support her family.

She intends to increase her inventory in order to have the possibility of increasing her sales and her income.  Dora Maria needs to buy merchandise like jeans, t-shirts, and children’s clothes, which will allow her to reach her objective.

In the future she would like to have her own clothing store and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 46-year old married woman with 8 children living in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her current business is selling secondhand clothes. She has been dealing in this business for the last 10 years. She started with 2,000,000 UGX, but now it is worth 5,000,000 UGX. Although Jane is progressing well, she faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. Her dream is educating her children and expanding her business into a renowned boutique in town. Jane needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to mulch her coffee plantation and buy a heifer for grazing

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en: John Patrick is a 46-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices agriculture, mainly growing bananas and coffee, which he started 20 years ago. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the rampant banana bacterial wilt disease. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent home and hiring employees to help expand his business. John Patrick needs the loan to build a commercial house.

loans.use: to build a commercial house

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret has applied for loans in the past and successfully used them to buy maize to sell to her customers. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and the high cost of labor. Her goals for the future are to open a food store where she can earn enough money to pay for the education of her children and buy a plot of land on which she can grow her own crops. She is applying for this loan to buy maize to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and shampoos.

loans.name: Shorook

texts.en:
Shorook is a 25 year old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. Shorook has a store for selling clothes. She established this profitable project three years ago and she wants to purchase winter clothes, in bulk, to resell and to increase her income, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Shorook has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for supplies for her store. She needs to take a loan amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Shorrok gets the loan, she will be able to purchase winter clothes in bulk. This will enable her to have a better collection of winter clothes and enable her to compete with other stores well. She will satisfy her customers' needs and increase her sales and her income. This will all lead to providing the family with better living conditions. Shorook is photographed in her store.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes, in bulk, for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 35-year old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in this business for ten years. He started transporting for another person and, after saving enough, he bought his own motorcycle. However, his challenge has been high fuel costs and the seasonal weather. His desire is to educate his children and to build a permanent home. He also longs to diversify and deal in other income generating activities. Julius needs the loan to buy a grass cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a music system.

loans.name: Review-Joshua Kioko

texts.en: Joshua Kioko is 30 years old and earns a living as a bodaboda (or motorcycle) operator in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married and has been in this line of work for two years. He is doing well and is applying for his first loan, for 12,000 shillings, to buy a new motorcycle. He will use the additional income made possible by this loan to support his family. His goal for the future is to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Pheoby

texts.en:
Phoebe is thirty five years old and married to Tom. They have 3 children. Phoebe has been operating a second-hand clothes business in Homabay town for the last 11 years. 

Phoebe is requesting for her first loan, with KADET Ltd., of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to buy stock of clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will pay back the loan and educate her children.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land and to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to sale.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio a sus 61 años de edad se dedica a prestar el servicio de reparación y montaje de llantas para automóviles y motos desde un pequeño local ubicado en la vía principal del municipio de Rionegro localizado al oriente de Antioquia. Gracias a esta actividad, el señor Octavio ha salido adelante junto con su esposa y dos hijos. Con el ánimo de mejorar el servicio que presta y sus ingresos, el señor Octavio necesita de la compra de llantas e insumos con los cuales pueda cumplir su meta y a futuro cumplir su sueño de ampliar su negocio y brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Octavio, 61, works offering repair service and tire assembly for cars and motorcycles in a small place located on the main street in the town of Rionegro, in Eastern Antioquia.  Thanks to this job Octavio has gotten ahead together with his wife and two children.  With the intention of improving the service he offers and his income, Octavio needs to buy tires and supplies with which he can achieve his goal and, in the future, his dream of expanding his business and giving his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and supplies such as glue and hammers.

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en: Yasinta is a 31 year old single woman. She owns a produce business, which she has been running for some time now. She started her business with 200,000 shillings. But now her capital base is steadily growing and the business is now worth 2,000,000 shillings. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and she hopes to educate her children. She wishes to expand her business to new markets and she is requesting for a loan to buy maize and rice to resell.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con las miembros de otro grupo que anteriormente trabajaba con la fundación. El grupo actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Cynthia es integrante del comité,  tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y tiene 2 hijas. Ella  se dedica a la venta de comestible en su domicilio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, puesto que sus vecinos acuden a ella para poder comprar los alimentos que prepara. Ella dice que todo lo que hace es por darles a sus hijas un futuro digno, ya que ella se encuentra sola.
Pide el crédito para la  compra de discos de empanadas, mayonesas, verduras, etc., los cuales son los ingredientes esenciales para los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed by the members of another group that had worked previously with the foundation.  The group currently is in its second loan cycle in Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs, and they want to be able to go all the way to the highest level of the program.

Cynthia is a member of the bank.  She is 21 years old and single, and has two daughters.  She works selling food in her home and she tells us that it is going very well for her because her neighbors come to her to be able to buy the food she prepares.  She says that everything she does is to give her daughters a future of dignity, since she is alone.

She is requesting the loan to buy shells for "empanadas" [small pies] , mayonnaise, vegetables, etc., which are the essential ingredients for the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy pie shells, mayonnaise, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es: La señora Maria Gladis ha sido una persona reconocida por ser dedicada a su trabajo y a su hogar. A sus 41 años, tiene una hija por la que se esfuerza todos los días por sacar adelante, y poder brindarle todo lo que necesite. Maria Gladis trabaja en una casa de familia, y para generar ingresos extra para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, tiene unas vacas lecheras desde hace algún tiempo. Actualmente una de sus vacas se encuentra enferma y esto le ha traído algunos inconvenientes, sin embargo, el espíritu de lucha de Maria Gladis la ha hecho seguir adelante.
texts.en: María Gladis has been a person recognized for being dedicated to her work and her home.  She is 41 years old and has a daughter for whom she makes the effort every day to get her ahead and be able to give her everything she needs.  María Gladis works in a family home, and for some time she has had dairy cows to generate extra income to cover her household expenses.  Currently one of her cows is sick and this has brought some problems.  Nevertheless, María Gladis's fighting spirit has made her carry on.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos como verduras, cereales y otros, en esta ocasión por la epoca la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de tarwi seco luego lo remoja y lo lleva  avender en Pisac, al socia también vende quinua pelada estos productos los vende los días martes, jueves, domingos. La socia desea a futuro prosperar con sus negocio y poder ver a sus hijos realizados en cuanto a sus estudios. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tarwi y de quinua para la venta.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling products such as vegetables, grains, and others.  Now, because of the season, she wants to invest the loan in buying dry tarwi.  Then she soaks it and takes it to Pisac to sell.  She also sells blanched quinoa.  She sells these products on Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday.  In the future she wants to prosper with her business and be able to see her children fulfilled with regard to their studies.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in buying tarwi and quinoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy tarwi and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Dina Raquel

texts.es: Dina, nuevamente solicita de nuevo otro préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución, para  invertirlo en su negocio y comprar mercadería como: manzanas, tomates, repollo, lechugas, zanahorias, remolachas, papas, vinagre y pescado, aprovechando esta época que es cuando más se vende.Los prestamos anteriores ayudaron a mejorar en sus ventas y a tener el negocio estable, una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is again applying for another new loan, because she likes the good service provided by our institution. This is to invest in her business and buy merchandise such as apples, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, beets, potatoes, vinegar, and fish. She is taking advantage of this season, which is when more is sold.

The previous loans helped improve her sales, and to have a stable business and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy apples, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, carrots, and beets.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formo con las integrantes de otro grupo, ya que decidieron trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder salir adelante y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa, todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de ayuda y cooperación.
La Sra Carmen es una integrante del comité, tiene 33 años de edad ,está casada con el Sr Jose, juntos tienen 5 hijos. La Sra Carmen se dedica a la venta de tortas en su domicilio. Dice que por medio de su trabajo y gracias a la buena venta que tiene puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma hacer que sea mas llevadero. Ella desea que sus hijos el día de mañana sean personas de bien y con una profesión.
Solicita el credito para comprar harina, huevos, mantecas, etc. Con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo las tortas que vende.
texts.en:
The group was formed with the members from another group, as they decided to work together, and through that work be able to move forward, and help one another. The communal bank is in the second loan cycle under the program. All of them are working in an environment of help and cooperation.

Carmen is a member of the communal bank. She is 33 years old, and married to José. They have five children. Carmen sells cakes from her home. She says that by means of her work, and thanks to the good sales she has, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses, and that way make these easier to bear. She wants her children to be good people, and have a profession.  

She is applying for the loan to buy flour, eggs, lard, etc. With these, she will be able to continue making the cakes that she sells.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, lard, etc. for making cakes.

loans.name: Review-Fredrick Oduor

texts.en:
Fredrick Oduor is a 31 year old electrician and he runs an electronics shop in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married and has been running this business for the last ten years. His business is doing great. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings from his business. 

Fredrick was recently introduced to KADET and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase sockets, electrical wires, bulbs and water heaters for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to further expand his business and to repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger electrical shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sockets, electrical wires, bulbs and water heaters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito por que quiere seguir mejorando más su vivienda y comprar materiales como lamina,madera y pago de mano de obra, con ello podra mejorar el techo de la casa, de esa forma podrá vivir mejor su familia. 
La experiencia con el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, porque mejoro mucho su vivienda por el cual quiere seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
María has again decided to get another loan, because she wants to continue improving her home. She wants to buy materials such as metal sheeting, and wood, and pay for labor. That way, her family will be able to live better. 

The experience with the previous loan helped her a lot, because she greatly improved her home, and therefore wants to continue working with our institution.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, and wood, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Cliente de 62 ans, elle est veuve et a 7 enfants plus et grand mère de 5 petits enfants ,A la mort de son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de des enfants ,elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais au marche.

Quand elle commence a Hope, elle vendait ses vivres frais sur un étalage,et depuis qu'elle a bénéficie de prêts de Hope, son activite a grandi, elle ne vend plus sur les étalages, a l'heure actuelle elle loue une chambre froide et elle achete en gros.
Les differents prêts ont fait eu de l'impact dans sa vie sociale et économique et familiale ,elle épargne constamment et fait ses remboursements sans difficultés et avec ses benefices elle prend soin de sa famille et elle assure la scolarité de ses petits enfants.

Elle a pour ambition de continuer d'aller vers l'avant et être une grossiste renommée des vivres frais.
texts.en:
Helene is a 62 year old client. She is a widow with seven children and five grandchildren. After the death of her husband, she began to sell fresh food at the market in order to support her family.

When she first started with Hope, she was selling her fresh food from a stand. After receiving loans from Hope, her business grew. She no longer sells from a stall, but rents a cold storage room and buys her products in bulk.

The loans have made an impact on her social, economic, and family life. Her savings are growing, and she pays back her loans without difficulty. With her profits, she takes care of her family and ensures the education of her grandchildren.

Her plan is to keep going and become a renowned wholesaler of fresh food.

loans.use: to buy boxes of beef, pork, oxtail

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 49-year old married and blessed with three children. He has been in business of hawking of assorted goods in Voi for the last ten years. He earns a monthly income of kes 19,800.

 He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000 he plans use the funds to purchase more wrist watches, flashlights, basins, key holders, and knives. With the anticipated profits he plans to purchase a motorcycle to aid him in transporting his goods with ease.
 
He hopes to have a more profitable business that will enable him to educate his children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase more wrist watches, flashlights, basins, key holders, and knives

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene necesidad de comprar materia prima para su negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que le ayude a comprar broches, hilo, agujas, telas de diferentes colores y tipos, esto le ayudará para mejorar la disponibilidad en su taller de costura, también ayudará para realizar sus trabajos de una manera eficiente.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia con los prestamos pues ha sabido administrarlos, anteriormente administraba una tienda y en la actualidad solamente tiene el taller de costura.
texts.en:
Blanca needs to buy raw material for her business. That's why she is applying for a new loan that helps her to buy fasteners, thread, needles, and fabric of different colors and types. This will help her improve the availability of supplies at her sewing workshop, and also help her carry out her work efficiently. 

She has had a good experience with the loans, as she has learned to manage them. Previously, she ran a store, and at the present time, she only has the sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy fasteners, thread, needles, and fabrics of different colors.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito de 42años de edad, convive con Antonieta hace más de 25 años. Con ella tiene a sus 8 hijos, pero solo vive con 4, el menor apenas tiene 3 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo de Shaoriato, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Benito es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. 
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. Ahora cuenta con 3 parcelas.
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café y kión.
“El kión es rentable como el café, cada kilo lo vendo a 2 soles y 50 céntimos, en diciembre llega a costar 3 soles con 50 céntimos, por que es escaso”, menciona. 
La siembra de kión es rentable, para los comuneros de la zona, por los suelos y condiciones climáticas. Benito produce 1500 kilos cada año y vende rápidamente para las empresas de condimentos y a otros compradores que se lo llevan como colorante. Benito quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones al resto de sus hijos que aún son menores de edad. Ésta sería la primera vez que Benito obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de San Pablo”.
Con el dinero que piensa obtener, pagará a los jornaleros a quienes contratará para la limpieza y cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Benito is 42, and has been living with his partner Antonieta for more than 25 years. They have eight children, but only live with four; the youngest is only three years old. They live in their own house in the native community of San Pablo de Shaoriato, in Pichanaki district, in Chanchamayo province.

Benito is an exemplary husband and father. His family is what drives all his efforts. He learned to do farm work from the time he was small. So it is that he started his own plantings in parcels of land that his community and his parents granted him. Now he has three parcels. In that way he has been able to supply and balance his production.

He grows coffee and kión (ginger). "Kion is profitable like coffee. I sell each kilo for 2 soles and 50 centimos. In December is will be worth three soles and 50 centimos, because it is scarce," he says. Planting kión is profitable for the villagers in the area, because of the soils and climatic conditions.

Benito produces 1,500 kilos each year, and it sells quickly to the condiment companies, and to other buyers who take it as a coloring agent. Benito wants to expand his plantings and increase his output. With that, he wants to provide better living conditions for the rest of his children who are still minors. 

This would be the first time that Benito has obtained a loan from MFP, so he gives his word that he will make his instalment payments on time. He is excited to be a part of the "Los Norionkis de San Pablo" communal bank. With the money that he intends to get, he will pay day laborers that he will hire for clearing work, and to harvest his crops.

loans.use: To hire day laborers.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La socia Saturnina,  continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores y venta de hortalizas, verduras, ganadería y agricultura, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de 15 pares de cuyes, 30 pares de gallinas; La socia solicita el credito para comprar 15 pares de cuyes y 30 pares de gallinas.
texts.en: Saturnina is continuing with her business raising small animals, selling vegetables and livestock, and farming.  At this time, she wants to invest a loan in the purchase of 15 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens.  She requests a loan to buy 15 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens.

loans.use: to buy 5 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder de 24 años, convive con Luz, con quien tiene a sus 2 hijas: Seicy de 2 años y Camila de 2 meses, sus grandes tesoros. Vive en una casa propia con su familia, en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo de Shaoriato, en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eder es un hombre de negocios y muy trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura en sus 2 parcelas de terrenos siembra café y kión. En la zona de San Pablo el kión es muy solicitado por las bondades de sus tierras y climas. Es así que cada año Eder cosecha 17 mil kilos, los que vende con éxito en la ciudad de Pichanaki. A Eder le gusta su trabajo, por ser más independiente y sobretodo porque sus ingresos dependen de su propio esfuerzo. Para agilizar su trabajo contrata personal que le ayuden a posear (acumular tierra alrededor de las plantas), desyerbar y sembrar sus cultivos. Cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica, cosecha el kión sin madurar llamado “Chikión”, que también es solicitado, pero su precio es un poco más bajo.
El piensa sembrar otros productos como el maíz para el próximo mes, para eso alquilará terrenos de vecinos o amigos. Sería la primera vez que Eder accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Norionkis de San Pablo”.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá pagar a los operarios que contratará para la limpieza y cultivos de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Eder, 24, lives with Luz, and together they have 2 daughters who are their greatest treasures: Seicy, who is 2 years old, and Camila, who is 2 months old.  They live in their own home in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shaoriato, in the Pichanaki district of the province of Chanchamayo.  Eder is a very hardworking businessman.  He farms 2 parcels of land, cultivating coffee and ginger.  Ginger from the San Pablo area is highly sought after, because the land and climate there is very good for growing it.  For this reason every year, Eder harvests 17,000 kilos, which he successfully sells in the city of Pichanaki.  Eder enjoys his work because he can be more independent, and most of all because his income depends upon his own efforts.  In order to facilitate his work, he hires people to help him put soil around the plants, weed and plant his crops.  When he has an urgent need for cash, he harvests the immature ginger, called “Chikión,” which is also in demand, although the price is lower.  

He is planning to plant other products such as corn in the next month, and to do this he will rent some land from neighbors or friends.  This will be the first time that Eder will take a loan through MFP.  He will be responsible for making his payments on time.  He is pleased to belong to the communal bank “Los Norionkis de San Pablo."

With the money from this loan, he will be able to pay for workers that he will hire to clear and cultivate his lands.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Laly

texts.es:
Laly de 19 años de edad. Convive con Alan, su pareja con quien cuida a Andrews, su hijo de 4 años. Ésta joven familia habita un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Laly está orgullosa con los resultados de sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. 
Ella y Alan se dedican a al agricultura. Ellos saben que les conviene y como negociarlo. En todo este tiempo juntos aprendieron que el café, el kión y las yucas nunca deben faltar en sus terrenos de cultivo. Es así que cuentan con una parcela y media de café y yuca cultivado y otra parcela de kión . Estas siembras están bien cuidadas y atendidas.
“Cada año el café me bota 30 sacos y el kión 1500 kilos. La yuca la vendo por arrobas a 12 soles, me va muy bien”, menciona. Los días en que los precios bajan, son desfavorables, pero nunca llegaron a perder su inversión.
Los compradores ya conocen a Laly y saben de la calidad de sus productos por eso los vende con facilidad, muchas veces en su propia comunidad. Espera iniciar más siembras adquiriendo más terrenos cultivables. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Laly obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo”, del que se muestra entusiasmada.
Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de víveres para la preparación de alimentos para los jornaleros que trabajarán sus tierras, a quienes también pagará por sus servicios.
texts.en:
Laly, 19, lives with her partner Alan, with whom she takes care of Andrews, her four-year-old son.  This young family live in their own home in the native community of San Pablo in the district of Pichanaki, province of Chanchamayo.  Laly is proud of the results of her effort and sacrifice.

She and Alan work in agriculture.  They know it is worthwhile for them and how to negotiate it.  In all this time together they learned that their fields should never be without coffee, ginger, and yucca.  This is why they have one-and-a-half plots of coffee and yucca and another plot of ginger.  These plants are well cared for and tended.

"Every year gives me 30 sacks of coffee and 1500 kilos of ginger.  I sell the yucca at 12 'soles' [$4.45 USD] per 11.5 kilos.  It is going very well for me," she mentions.  The days on which prices go down are unfavorable, but it never came to losing their investment.

The buyers already know Laly and they know about the quality of her products, so she sells them easily, many times in her own community.  She hopes to introduce more plants, acquiring more arable land.

This will be the first loan that Laly will get from MFP.  She is excited about it.  Now she is part of Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo Communal Bank, about which she is enthusiastic.

She will invest the money in buying food to prepare meals for the day laborers who will work their land, whom they also will pay for their services.

loans.use: to pay for the services of day laborers and buy food to feed them.

loans.name: Andre

texts.fr:
Client de 54ans, marié, père de 6 enfants dont l’âge est compris entre 16 et 30 ans.
Après sa formation en coupe et couture sur patron, il a ouvert son atelier voila 20 ans avec un capital de 300.000 F.
C’est  son 3em prêt et cela lui permet de renforcer, d’améliorer et de maintenir sa clientèle.
Avec ce prêt, il va acheter les rouleaux de tissus (gabardine, lin, tergals, velours, super 200, doublure, vaseline) file, aiguilles.
La seule difficulté reste le non retrait du vêtement finis et sa stratégie est de faire  une maison de vente des costumes prêt-à-porter.
Quatre de ses enfants sont encore sur le banc de l’école, il se bat pour qu’il s suivent une bonne éducation scolaire  et il se bat pour finir sa  maison en location pour assurer leur bien être.
Il a un sens de l’organisation et respecte  ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients.
texts.en:
Andre is a 54 year old client. He is married and father of six children between the ages of 16 and 30. After an apprenticeship in tailoring and dressmaking, he opened his shop 20 years ago with a capital of 300,000 XAF.

This is his third loan and it will allow him to grow, improve, and maintain his clientele. With the loan, he is going to buy rolls of fabric (gabardine, wool, Terylene, velvet, super 200, lining, Vaseline), thread, and needles. The only problem is when people do not show up to pick up their finished clothing. His strategy is to sell ready-made suits.

Four of his children are still in school. He is trying to ensure that they receive a good education, and he is working to complete his rental house in order to ensure their well-being.

He is well-organized and honors his commitments to his clients.

loans.use: to buy rolls of Terylene fabric, wool, super 100, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Fidelia, continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría gallinas, cuyes; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de animales menores como 20 cuyes y 10 pares de gallinas para la crianza, reproducción y venta.
texts.en: Fidelia continues with her business raising small farm animals; she raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of small farm animals like 20 guinea pigs and 10 pairs of chicks to raise, breed and sell.

loans.use: to buy 20 guinea pigs and 10 pairs of chicks to raise, breed and sell.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
Diana, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para iniciar una nueva inversión en el negocio comprando blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos,  para salir a ofrecer a sus clientes en esta nueva temporada donde muchos compran sus estrenos para la Nochebuena y fin de año, ella desea estar preparada para atender la demanda y generar mayores ventas.
Éstos préstamos le han permitido a Diana crecer en el negocio y tener más clientela, cambiando así las circunstancias familiares y mejorando su condición económica.
texts.en: Diana is asking for a loan once more to make a new investment in her business buying blouses, skirts, pants and dresses to go out and sell to her customers in this new season when many buy new clothes to wear for the first time on Christmas Eve and New Year’s.  She wants to be prepared to meet demand and to generate more sales.  These loans have made it possible for Diana to grow in her business and to have more customers thus changing her family circumstances and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants and dresses.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, tiene la necesidad de continuar surtiendo el negocio de medicinas, en esta ocasión comprará medicamentos naturales tanto antibióticos, vitaminas así como para enfermedades corporales, en pastillas, jarabes, cremas, inyecciones con esta inversión espera mantener una buena disponibilidad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella considera que a través de sus préstamos ha logrado crecer y mejorar su servicio para las personas que demandan de sus productos, ha beneficiado a su familia con una condición más solvente.
texts.en: María needs to continue stocking her business with medicines.  On this occasion she’ll buy natural medicines like antibiotics and vitamins as well as for body illnesses in the form of pills, syrups, creams and injections.  With this investment she hopes to have good stock availability to offer her customers.  She believes that through the loans she’s been able to grow and offer better service to people requesting her products; it has benefitted her family with a more solvent condition.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, vitamins, pills, syrups and creams.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 22 años, hace 8 años comparte su vida con Adán, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años de edad. Está feliz familia vive en la comunidad nativa Alto San Pablo de Shaoriato, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Edith creció en el campo. Vio a sus padres trabajar la tierra y por eso aprendió a desenvolverse con facilidad en sus propios terrenos. Ahora ella cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, ahí siembra café y kión. Cada uno de estos productos es muy bien cuidado por ella y Adán. Ambos distribuyen su tiempo para dedicarse a la limpieza, abonamiento, y cosecha de sus cultivos.
Cuando es época de cosecha el trabajo es más intenso y tiene que contratar personal para apresurarlo. Una vez cosechado, traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki y los ofrece por kilos, latas o cajones. Ahí los compradores ya la conocen.
“Al año el kión vota 1000 kilos y lo vendo a 2 soles el kilo, si es rentable, solo hay que limpiarlo siempre”, comenta. Ella está contenta ya que se preocupa por la producción orgánica, y espera multiplicar su producción, para ello deberá alquilar o comprar terrenos. Esas son metas más próximas. Sería la primera vez que Edith  obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso manifiesta ser responsable con el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Norionkis de alto San Pablo”, del que siente contenta y esperanzada. Invertirá el dinero en el pago de jornaleros para que limpien sus cultivos de café y kión. Además comprará los alimentos para atenderlos en las jornadas.
texts.en:
Edith, 22, has been sharing her life with Adán for the last 8 years; they have three children who are 7, 5, and 2 years old.  This happy family lives in the indigenous community of Alto San Pablo de Shaoriato in Pichanaki Province in Chanchamayo.  

Edith grew up in the countryside.  She watched her parents work the land and that’s how she learned to develop easily in her own land.  She now has two parcels of farmable land where she grows coffee and ginger.  Each of these products is very well cared for by her and by Adán.  They both divide their time up between weeding, fertilizing and harvesting their crops.

When it is harvest time and work is more intense she has to hire staff to make it go more quickly.  Once harvested, she transports her products to the city of Pichanaki to be sold by the kilo, can or case.  Buyers there already know her.

“In a year, 1000 kilos of ginger is produced and I sell it for 2 soles a kilo; it is profitable but one has to clean it always,” she comments.  She’s happy because she’s concerned about organic production and she hopes to multiply production.  To do so, she must lease or buy more land.  Those are her immediate goals.

This will be the first time Edith will get an MFP loan and she states that she will be responsible with her installment payments.  She’s a member of the “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo” communal bank that she feels happy and hopeful about.

She will use the money to pay day laborers to clean her coffee and ginger crops; in addition she’ll buy food to feed them.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy food for them.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva de 45 años convive con Andrés y tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de 16 años, ya que los demás son independientes. Ella vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo de Shaoriato, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eva trabaja mucho. La agricultura es su vida por que desde niña creció rodeada de plantaciones de café y plátanos. A eso se dedicaban sus padres y ella, fiel a ese ejemplo también lo hace. Eva contenta, comenta que tiene 10 parcelas de terrenos, en ellos siembra café, achiote, kión y plátanos. A todos sus cultivos cuida por igual y siempre le ha ido bien en las ventas. Muchas veces, cuando el precio bajaba tenía problemas pero nunca perdía su inversión. Además recuperaba con la venta de sus otras producciones.
Eva y Andrés trabajan juntos, pero no es suficiente, por ello invierten en la contrata de personal operario para apresurar las jornadas.
Ella tiene planes que los realizará en poco tiempo. Tiene destinada una parcela para sembrar plátanos, para ello requiere 250 mamones para iniciar su cultivo. Además piensa producir cítricos, como naranjas y limones. Para eso deberá ahorrar y comprar nuevas plantas. Sería la primera vez que Eva accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Norionkis de San Pablo”.
Con el dinero podrá comprar nuevas plantas de naranjas para sembrarlos en sus terrenos. Además invertirá en el pago de los servicios de los operarios quienes plantarán las nuevas naranjas.
texts.en:
Eva, 45, lives with Andrés and has five children but only lives with her youngest 16-year-old since the others are now independent.  She lives in her own house in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shaoriato, Pichanaki District in Chanchamayo Province.  

Eva works very much.  Farming is her life because as a little girl she grew up surrounded by coffee and banana plantations.  That’s what her parents did and faithful to their example so does she.  Eva comments that she has ten parcels of land where she grows coffee, achiote, ginger and bananas.  She cares for all these crops equally and has always done well with her sales.  Many times when prices dropped she’d have problems but she never lost her investment; she’d recuperate with the sale of her other products.  Eva and Andrés work together but it’s not enough.  Because of that they invest in hiring staff to quicken the daily work load.

She has plans she expects to carry out in a short time.  She has a parcel destined for banana planting but needs 250 offshoots to start her planting.  She also plans to produce citrus fruit like oranges and lemons.  For that, she must save up and buy new plants.  

This will be the first time Eva accesses an MFP loan.  She takes on the responsibility of being punctual with her installment payments.  She feels happy to belong to the “Los Norionkis de San Pablo” communal bank.

With the money she’ll be able to buy new orange plants to plant in her fields.  She’ll also use the money to pay labor costs for day laborers who will plant the new oranges.

loans.use: to buy orange plants and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor continua con la principal actividad en la agricultura, el socio también siembra papas, maiz, quinua y tarwi, el socio tambien es peón en una bloqueteria, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de semillas para sembrar quinua, tarwi y papa, el socio desea poder ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y continuar con su negocio de manera exitosa.
texts.en: Víctor continues with his main activity in farming.  He grows potatoes, corn, quinoa and tarwi [lupine].  He also works as a laborer in a brick factory.  On this occasion he wants to use the loan to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.  He wants to help his children with their higher education and to continue with his business successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 4 años y vende nacatamales (comida típica a base de cerdo, la cual en esta época es muy común su comercio en mayores cantidades).  Ella tuvo 23 hijos de los cuales 15 están vivos y ya todos son mayores de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en productos granos básicos, maíz, cerdo, leña…etc.
texts.en: Gloria is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had a small business for the last four years selling nacatamales (typical fast food based on pork which during this season sells in larger amounts).  She has 23 children and 15 of them are adults and still living.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, corn, pork, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, corn, pork, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ledmy Esther

texts.es:
Ledmy es una joven de 21 años de edad muy trabajadora y optimista, ha trabajado desde pequeña porque sus padres no tenían muchos medios económicos y con su trabajo los apoyaba para los gastos de la casa, ella a pesar de lo difícil de su infancia, Ledmy vive en una choza, pero eso no la amilana para salir adelante y con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria.
 
Ella ha trabajado de todo y con los ingresos que obtenia, poco a poco pudo juntar el dinero suficiente y con ello inicion su negocio de venta de ropa, Ledmy camina por las calles de su barrio vendiendo sus productos , los cuales tienen mucha acogida por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy atenta con ellos y sobre todo porque es honrada y honesta, lleva trabajando en este negocio desde hace ya 1 año y medio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque desde muy temprano sale a las calles para ofrecer sus productos y ese esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, como dice el dicho “ Al que madruga Dios lo ayuda”.

Ledmy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá mejorar su vivienda ya que ella desea colocar un kiosco para ofrecer sus productos y no mucho a las calles y con esta mejora ella tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y mas seguridad para ella asi como tambien mejores ingresos y poder cumplir su mas grande sueño: "Tener una vivienda optima para vivir"
texts.en:
Ledmy, 21, is a very hardworking, optimistic young woman.  She’s worked since childhood because her parents did not have many economic resources and she helped cover household expenses with her work.  Despite the difficulties in her childhood, Ledmy lives in a hut but this does not discourage her from continuing forward and with much effort she works selling clothes in an itinerant manner.

She has worked at everything and with the income she earned she gradually saved up enough money to start a business selling clothes.  Ledmy travels along the streets in her neighborhood selling her wares which are well received by her customers because she’s very attentive to them and, above all, because she’s very honest and trustworthy.  She’s been working in this business for a year and a half and she believes that she does well because she heads out to the streets very early to offer her products and this effort has its reward; like the saying states: “God helps she who gets up early.”

Ledmy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she’ll be able to finish building her dwelling and and be able to improve her home and install a kiosk and not spend so much time on the streets. This improvement will mean a better quality of life and more security for her since she’ll have a dwelling in good condition.  For her, her greatest dream is: “To have an optimum dwelling to live in.”

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Catalina
