La señora Martha,  indica que hace mas de cinco años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su hermana. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que comprará la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene cuatro hijos y es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud, la atención del personal y el servicio.
texts.en:
The community association "FLOR KANTUTITA" began its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Germán Busch. It is made up of eleven members and it is guided by a board of directors headed by Martha. The members of the community association go forward with various businesses, among them we have: food sales, cosmetics sales, kebab sales, blanket weaving, sewing aprons, making tulmas, driver, and caretaker.

Martha says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for more than five years, and she joined the institution at the invitation of her sister. Currently she has a grocery business that she's been working at for years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (for buying groceries) which she will buy in the commercial sector of the city ("La Ceja") and later sell at the community marketplaces. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family, as she is single with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes health, personal attention, and the service.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Olga Elizabeth

texts.es:
Olga de 33 años es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de morocho (postre caliente). Comenzó su negocio vendiendo en una carretilla con la ayuda de su cuñada poco a poco le genero ventas elevada y decidió mantener el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajado. El vaso de morocho pequeño lo vende a $ 0.60 y el grande a $ 0.80. 

Quiere mejorar su negocio físicamente por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena, pinturas.
texts.en:
33-year old Olga is a hardworking woman who runs a business selling morocho (a hot dessert made from corn). She started out selling from a cart helped by her sister-in-law. Then gradually sales increased and she continued with the business to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

Olga has many hopes for the future of her business so she wants to continue working. A small glass of morocho costs $0.60 and a big one $0.80.

She wishes to improve the physical state of the business so she wants to use the loan money to buy cement, sand, and paint.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and paint

loans.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Máyela, debido a la necesidad de aumentar en sus ingresos y siempre mantener su negocio estable ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo para comprar cerdos y crecerlos para luego venderlos con el objetivo siempre de tener lo necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque mejoro las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia
texts.en: Máyela, due to the need of increasing income and always maintain her business’ stability, decided to request another loan to buy piglets to raise and later sell aiming at always having available everything necessary for her family’s support.  The prior loan helped her much because she improved her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Omar Alonso

texts.es:
Omar tiene 24 años de edad es un joven muy emprendedor, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad cálida y afectuosa muy conocida como la Tierra del sol Eterno, por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, con sus majestuosas dunas y su muy conocida  “Laguna de Huacachina”, sus pobladores son muy acogedores y hospitalarios, así como también luchadores, ya que a pesar del terremoto ocurrido en el año 2007 no se han dejado vencer por la adversidad y siguen adelante, en esta ciudad generosa vive Omar. Omar le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Ingeniería de sistemas, en sus tiempos libres Omar disfruta de jugar el futbol, es un deporte que lo apasiona mucho.

Omar es muy trabajador, tanto es su esfuerzo que el tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y ademas su negocios cabinas de internet (cibercafe), aunque sea un poco tedioso él con mucho esfuerzo maneja los dos negocios, con el apoyo de su mano derecha que es su pareja, a pesar que ella aun estudia, colabora mucho en el negocio y es quien le da ánimo para seguir adelante, Omar le dedica al negocio 10 horas diarias, en el cual puede atender alrededor de 15 a 20 clientes diarios, en un dia puede ganar hasta S/.200, pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.300.

Omar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias al apoyo el podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa, asi como tambien renovar sus cabinas de internet, con esta mejoría el podrá tener más variedad en los productos que ofrece y le permitirá mejorar las instalaciones de su cabina para que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos, con ello generara mayores ingresos para poder ahorrar y cumplir uno de sus mas grandes sueños:” Tener su propio auto”
texts.en:
Omar is 24 years old and is a very entrepreneurial young man. He lives in the city of Ica, a warm and affectionate place that is known as the Land of Eternal Sun due to its warm climate throughout the year. It has majestic dunes and a well known oasis, "Laguna de Huacahina". The people of the city are very welcoming and hospitable in addition to being fighters. Despite the earthquake that occurred in 2007, they have not allowed themselves to be defeated by adversity and continue forward. Omar lives in this generous city. Omar really would like to study Systems Engineering. In his free time he enjoys playing soccer as it is a sport that he has a lot of passion for. 

Omar is a hard worker. His effort is so great that he has a business selling clothing as well as a business in internet booths (cyber cafe). Though it is a bit tedious, he manages both businesses with a lot of effort and with the support of his right-hand, his partner. Despite the fact that she is still studying, she helps out a lot with the business and is the person who gives him the motivation to get ahead. Omar works ten hours a day at his business, during which time he attends to around 15 or 20 customers daily. In one day he can make up to 200 PEN, but on a good day he can make up to 300 PEN. 

Omar really appreciates the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support he will be able to buy more merchandise for his clothing sales business as well as renovate his internet booths. This improvement he will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer and it will allow him to improve the cyber cafe facilities so thta the customers will feel more comfortable. With this he will generate mor income to be able to save and follow through on one of his biggest dreams: to own his own car.

loans.use: to set up his business and to buy equipment.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 31 años, convive con Milka de 28 años, fruto de esta relación nacieron Max y Yegner  con los que viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia. Jesús, es un agricultor que se ha dedicado por mas de 10 años al cultivo de café. Su campo agrícola se encuentra dentro de su distrito a 30 minutos de su casa. Pues es ahí donde trabaja com mucha dedicación y entrega en compañia de su esposa. Sin embargo, nos comenta que fracasó como comerciante ambulante a causa de un accidente de transito donde perdio su mercadería, desde entonces se vio en la necesidad de emprender otro negocio que no le exigiera mucha inversión. Así que lo único que tenía era su terreno, desde entonces trabaja arduamene desde que amanece hasta que termina el día, y poco a poco fue que tuvo estabilidad económica. Jesús esta contento con su producción, en un futuro desea salir a la ciudad a emprender un nuevo negocio. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en la ampliación de sus cultivos de café, por lo que comprará semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Jesús, 31, lives with Milka, 28, and they have two children: Max and Yegner that they live with in their own house located in the settlement of Chuvivana in Sivia District.  Jesús is a farmer and has been growing coffee for over ten years.  His farmland is located in a district 30 minutes from home.  He works there with much dedication and devotion in company of his wife.  

However, he comments that he failed as a street vendor due to a traffic accident where he lost all his merchandise.  Since then, he found himself in need of finding a different business that didn’t require much investment.  The only thing he had was his piece of land so he works hard from dawn to dusk and gradually has attained economic stability.  Jesús is happy with his production and in the future would like to go to the city to start a new business.

This is his first MFP loan and he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to invest in the expansion of his coffee crops.  He will therefore buy seeds and manure.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and manure.

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para arreglar el interior de la vivienda, que es comprar el material que es cemento,pintura para el interior y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la mejora; con el cual mejorar el aspecto de la casa, anteriormente solicito un crédito con nosotros para ampliar la parte alta a un no ha terminado en su totalidad pero quiere terminar primero la parte baja y así terminar los cuartos de la planta alta. 

Doña Rosa trabaja toda la semana en la vecina ciudad y su esposo trabaja registrando carros, y ambos forman una familia de cuatro hijos dos de ellos, ya están casados y tiene su propia familia y los otros dos están en la etapa escolar, por lo cuales se esfuerzan en sus trabajos para poderles brindarles lo mejor posible y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a loan to improve the interior of her house. She will buy cement and paint and pay workers who will make the improvements. She requested a previous loan with us to expand the second floor and hasn’t finished it completely but wants to first finish the ground floor and then complete the rooms upstairs.

Rosa works all week in the neighboring city and her husband works registering cars; they both form a family with four children.  Two of the children are already married and have their own families and the other two are still attending school so they work hard at their jobs to be able to provide them with the best possible and to improve their lives.

loans.use: to do some interior home improvements.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German, originario de Estelí, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas además de tener una pequeña pulpería en su casa. Los prestamos  que ha recibido de Kiva han sido de muchos éxitos para su negocio su siembra de tomates ha ido prosperando al igual su pulpería que ha venido creciendo poco a poco. El esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de una maquina moto bomba para fumigar un plantío de ½ manzana de tomates.  Ya que necesita controlar las plagas y enfermedades del cultivo y protegerlo al máximo para vender una producción de calidad y disminuir costos. El desea ampliar sus áreas de siembra y diversificar los cultivos.
texts.en: German is from Estelí and is a farmer by profession.  He grows vegetables and also has a small, home-based grocery store.  The loans he’s gotten from Kiva have been of much success for his business; his tomato crops have progressed and his grocery store has been gradually growing.  He’s asking for this loan to buy a sprayer to fumigate his ½-manzana [Central American unit of land measure] plot of tomatoes because he needs to control infestations and crop illnesses and protect them to the maximum degree so that he can sell quality products and reduce costs.  He wants to expand his growing area and diversify his crops.

loans.use: to buy a sprayer.

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Orestes tiene 44 años, convive con Carlota de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia. Orestes es un hombre con deseos de superación, con bastante experiencia para los negocios. A los 7 años se separó de su familia y no fue al aolegio viviendo de pequeños trabajos para subsistir, cuando ya tenía 18 años conoció a Carlota y juntos formaron una familia, entonces ya trabajaba como agricultor cultivando café en la parcela que su suegro le cedió. Poco a poco fueron saliendo de la pobreza y compraron su propio terreno donde ahora construyeron su vivienda. Ahi montaron una tienda de abarrotes y venta de combustibles, con la finalidad de incrementar su ingreso económico familiar.
Está feliz y contento por su labor ya que le es tan rentable que piensa en un futuro ampliar su negocio.
Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, por lo que contratará peones.
texts.en:
Orestes, 44, lives with Carlota, 40, and they have three children.  They live together in the settlement of Chuvivana in Sivia District.  Orestes is a man who very much wants to get ahead and has quite a bit of business experience.  

At the age of seven he left his family and did not attend school living off small jobs to subsist.  When he turned 18 he met Carlota and they formed a family.  He was already working as a coffee farmer then on a piece of land his father-in-law ceded to him.  Gradually they started to move out of poverty and they bought their own piece of property where they built their house.  They opened a store there selling groceries and fuel in order to increase family income.  He is happy and content with his work because he feels it’s profitable and in future he plans to expand it.

This will be his first MFP loan and he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to invest in his fields: he will hire day laborers.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Olibia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Olibia es una mujer trabajadora comenzó vendiendo artículos de papelería para ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ahora tiene un pequeño negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. Vendiendo papelería y artículos para el hogar. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar el inventario que tienen en la papelería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas, cuadernos, plumas etc.  

En el futuro quiere tener una papelería grande para generar mayores ingresos y darle a sus tres hijos la economía que necesitan.
texts.en: Olibia is a hardworking woman who started to sell stationery items to help cover household expenses.  Now she has a small business in the front part of her house selling stationery items and items for the home.  She has many hopes for her business and wants to improve the inventory she has in her shop.  She wants to use the loan to buy display cases, notebooks, pens, etc.  In the future, she’d like to have a large stationery shop to generate higher income and provide her three children with the economy they need.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens and pencils.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: Rosendo de 64 años, está casado con Silveria de 57 años de edad, juntos tienen 6 hijos, del que cada uno tiene su propia familia. Rosendo y Silveria viven armoniosamente en su propia casa ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia.  A pesar de ser mayor de edad, es un hombre que aún no ha perdido las ganas de continuar con el trabajo agrícola. Él posee una parcela de 4 hectáreas de café, asimismo tiene una tienda de abarrotes y además de ser uno de los hombres más representativos en su comunidad. Rosendo se encarga de cultivar con la ayuda de dos  peones, quienes lo apoyan en las faenas diarias; mientras que Silveria, los asiste con los alimentos, además de estar a cargo de los quehaceres de la casa y así como de su local comercial. Por el que esta orgulloso por tener una ejemplar mujer y haya sido una buena madre. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por el que se compromete por segunda vez en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el pago a sus personales de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosendo, 64, is married to Silveria, 57, and they have six children together; each has a family of their own.  Rosendo and Silveria live lovingly in their own house located in the settlement of Chuvivana in Sivia District.  Despite being older, he’s a man who has not lost the desire to continue working in farming.  

He owns a four-hectare parcel of coffee and he also has a grocery store and in addition is one of his community’s most distinguished men.  

Rosendo farms with the help of two laborers who help him with his daily tasks while Silveria helps them providing them with meals as well as being in charge of household chores and her store.  He is proud to have such an exemplary woman and good mother at his side.

This will be his second MFP loan and he commits for the second time to be punctual with his installment payments.  He will use the 1500 new soles to pay his laborers’ wages.

loans.use: to pay his day laborers' wages.

loans.name: Inti Amaru

texts.es:
El joven Inti, sigue laborando como contador, para el bienestar familiar, sigue soltero y su meta cada dia, es seguir mejorando su vivienda, en donde vive con sus hermano y padre.
Con el credito anterior logro, cerrar con tapia, ahora desea cambiar el techo de la cocina, comprando laminas de zinc y cuartones de madera, clavos, para mejorar esta condicion, que le ha venido dando, probremas en temporada de invierno. El cual podra cubrir esta necesidad familiar, a corto plazo con el financiamiento que la institucion ha dado.
texts.en: Young Inti continues working as an accountant for his family’s wellbeing.  He’s single and his goal every day is to continue making home improvements where he lives with his brother and father.  With the previous loan he managed to enclose with walls and now he wants to replace the kitchen’s roof buying metal sheets and wood beams and nails to improve this condition since it’s been causing problems in the winter.  He will be able to cover this family need in the short run with the loan the institution has given him.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder de 35 años es soltero, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Wilder es un hombre dedicado al servicio de la sociedad, de profesión educador, actualmente se desempeña como regidor en el distrito de Sivia. Wilder tiene un terreno agrícola que heredó de sus padres, en el ha plantado cacao (injerto). Asimismo para que pueda desempeñar con mator rapidez su trabajo contrata dos jornaleros que siempre están al tanto del mantenimiento, pero Wilder no deja de supervisar sus plantas. Actualmente no tiene benficio alguno de su trabajo, por lo que ahora esta invirtiendo esperando que mas adelante pueda cosechar las ganancias que le dejará su producción de cacao y esto será dentro de 2 años. Wilder está feliz por el buen trabajo que vienen realizando en su campo agrícola. Por tanto solicitará un segundo credito con MFP, y del que se compromete otra vez  en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Wilder es el secretario en su banco comunal por lo que agradece a los que lo integran por esa confianza. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles invertirá en el pago al personal.
texts.en:
Wilder is 35 years old, he is single and he lives in own house which is located in the district of Sivia. Wilder provides services to society by working in the education sector. He is currently working as a stage manager in the Sivia district. Wilder has an agricultural plot of land which he inherited from his parents in which he has planted cocoa beans. In order to finish his work more quickly, he also hires two day laborers who always keep on top of the maintenance but Wilder always oversees his staff. 

He currently has no income from the work so he is investing, in the hope that in the future he will be able to reap the profits that his cocoa production will generate, which will be within 2 years. Wilder is happy with the good work that is carried out on his agricultural land. Therefore he is applying for a second loan with MFP and again he promises to make all his repayments on time. Wilder is the secretary of his communal bank so he is grateful to the members for trusting him with this role. He will pay his staff with the 2,500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to pay his day laborers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 33 años convive con Javier de 48 años, fruto de esta relación nació Ángel de 9 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Catunrumi del distrito de Pichari.  María es una mujer llena de talento para el negocio, posee una movilidad con el que su esposo trabaja, realizando servicio de taxi. Y como todo vehículo con el uso continuo, uno de los repuestos del eje principal se rompió, por lo requiere comprar uno nuevo. María aparte de realizar los quehaceres de la casa, estudia cosmetología, por lo que le faltan dos meses para concluir sus estudios. Una vez terminado desea pronto abrir su salon de belleza para apoyar a su querido esposo con el ingreso económico familiar. Por tanto éste será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará dicho repuesto para su vehiculo.
texts.en:
María, 33, lives with Javier, 48.  Ángel, 9, was born from this relationship.  Together they live in their own house located in the community of Catunrumi in the Pichari district.

María is a woman full of talent for business.  She has an automobile with which her husband works offering taxi service.  And as with continual use of any vehicle, one of the parts of the principal axis broke, so she needs to buy a new one.

In addition to doing the household chores, María is studying cosmetology and has two months left to finish her studies.  Once finished she wants to open a beauty salon quickly to help her beloved husband with the family income.

This will be her first loan with MFP, for which she has committed to making her payments punctually.  With the 1,500 PEN she will buy the mentioned part for her car.

loans.use: to buy parts for her car.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maryuri Eunice

texts.es: La señora Maryuri S., originaria de Estelí, casada, de oficio agricultora. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada atravez del préstamo Kiva, pues le fue de mucha ayuda ya que logro comprar insumos para siembra de café siente que ha fortalecido sus cosechas. En esta ocasión esta solicitando el crédito para compra de insumos para sembrar hortalizas. Su papa la esta apoyando para impulsar los cultivos de hortalizas ya que ella le gusta diversificar y salir adelante aportar en su hogar. Ella espera ampliar el área de siembras de hortalizas y mejorar la calidad de producción.
texts.en: Doña Maryuri is a native of Estelí.  She is married and works as a farmer.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she was given with a Kiva loan as it helped her a great deal.  She bought supplies to plant coffee.  She feels that it has strengthened her crops.  Again she is requesting a loan to buy supplies to plant vegetables.  Her father is encouraging her to plant vegetables as she likes to diversify and provide for her household.  She hopes to expand the area where she plants vegetables and improve her production quality.

loans.use: purchase supplies to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Juana, es una joven de 26 años de edad, nacida en la comunidad llamada La Rica localizada en Jinotega, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella es comerciante vende ropa y mercadería en General desde hace 5 años.  Su negocio o inicio con la iniciativa de independizarse y generar ingresos por ella misma al mismo tiempo sentir útil de apoyar en el hogar y sus hijos para que no les falte nada. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como ropa, zapatos, camisas, útiles escolares. Pues se acerca la temporada escolar y quiere tener surtida su tienda para ofrecer nuevos y mejores productos. Por lo pronto quiere mejorar las ventas, introducir nueva mercadería que le ayuden hacer crecer su negocio. Siempre buscando como mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 26-years old and was born in the community called La Rica, located in Jinotega.  She is married, has two children, and is a merchant who has sold clothes and general merchandise for the past five years.  Her business began with the goal of becoming independent and generating income for herself.  At the same time, she wanted to feel useful and support the home and her children, so they might want for nothing.

She requests this loan to buy merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, shirts, and school supplies.  The school year will begin shortly, and she wants to have her store stocked in order to offer new and better products.  For now, she wants to improve sales and introduce new merchandise that will help her business grow.  She is always looking for ways to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as clothes, shoes, shirts, and school supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” está conformado por 08 socios responsables, que llevan trabajando 08 meses con el Programa- Prosperidad siendo Gladys una de las integrantes. Gladys tiene 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de  lencerías la cual lleva 03 años en este negocio, aparte ofrece productos de belleza de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, Gladys no cuenta con un local  es por ello que trabajo a pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, gracias a estas actividades le ha permitido a Gladys apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Uno de sus anhelos es de tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus lencerías. Con el crédito que recibió piensa comprar brasieres y trusas pues tiene pedidos por entregar. La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” agradecen a los prestamistas ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Empresarias communal bank is made up of eight responsible members who have been working with the Prosperidad program for eight months.  Gladys is one of the members.  Gladys is 54 years old and married, and has two grown children.  She works selling lingerie, and has been in this business for three years.  She also sells beauty products to get additional income for her home.  Gladys does not have a shop, so she works through orders that her customers request from her.  Thanks to these activities Gladys has been able to help her husband with the household expenses.  One of her desires is to have a place where she can show her lingerie.

With the loan she received, she plans to buy bras and girdles because she has orders to fulfill.  The Mujeres Empresarias communal bank thanks the lenders because they make it possible for them to make progress.

loans.use: to buy bras and girdles.

loans.name: Elida Luz

texts.es:
Elida Luz  tiene 31 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre disfruta de leer, con lo cual se relaja un poco; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le gusta a Elida  son los “Tallarines Rojos”. Elida estudió hasta el quinto año de secundaria, debido a los pocos recursos económicos que tenían sus padres. Elida es casada, su pareja trabaja como obrero de construcción, juntos tienen 2 hijos, que son su razón de ser, nos comenta Elida.

Elida se dedica al alquiler de maquinaria de construcción, trabaja alrededor de 4 horas diarias, ella se animo a tener este negocio gracias a su esposo ya que conoce de este rubro. En un día Elida  puede atender 6 clientes diariamente y esto le permite ganar hasta  S/. 100 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.150 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para el hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido  a que tiene maquinaria en muy buen estado y por el  buen trato que tiene con sus clientes.

Elida está muy agradecida con los prestatarios ya que con este apoyo podrá brindarle mantenimiento a su maquinaria;  con esta mejora tendrá maquinarias en buen estado y así evitar que haya algún tipo de accidente y así poder en algunos meses ahorrar para cumplir su gran sueño: “Ampliar su negocio”.
texts.en:
Elida Luz is 31 years old, and she lives in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, which is approximately four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and hailed by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" ("Land of the Sun").  Ica is well known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007, and a 6.9 in 2011); its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives; and perhaps above all, as the source of Peru's traditional liquor, Pisco.  

In this hot and arid climate, one encounters the home and business of Elida Luz.  In her free time, she enjoys reading, which relaxes her a bit.  As is generally known, Peru's cuisine is one of the most delicious in the world; one of Elida's favorite dishes is "Tallarines Rojos" (a Peruvian style pasta in red sauce).  She only studied through the fifth year of secondary school, due to the limited economic resources of her parents.  She is married, her husband is a construction worker, and together they have two children, who are the center of her life.  

Elida rents construction equipment and works for about four hours per day.  She is excited to have this business, thanks to her husband, who is already familiar with this line of work.  In one day, Elida may work with six clients, which allows her to earn up to S/.100 each day.  In a good day, she can earn up to S/.150, which allows her to pay for expenses around the home and to re-invest in the business.  She believes that her business is going well because her equipment is in good shape and due to the good relationship that she has with her clients.     

Elida is very happy with her borrowers, and with this loan, she can provide them with maintenance for her equipment.  With this improvement, she will have equipment in good condition, thereby avoiding possible accidents so that, in a few months, she can save enough money in order to accomplish her great goal:  "Expand her business".

loans.use: To maintain equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Karel

texts.en:
Karel is a 51-year-old man and married. He has 4 children, namely: Defri, 31, Sarce, 25 – both married; Julius, 21, is working in a cooperative; Fadly, 18, graduated from Senior High School.

Karel is running a petrol stall business to support his family. He has been running the business for years. Karel often does some odds job such as mini-van driver, construction worker, etc. to generate more income. Karel dreams of expanding his petrol business to enable him to generate more income for his family, but he does not have money to do so. He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more petrol. Karel is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more petrol.

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en: Sakhorn, 42, is widowed and resides with three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store at home for over nine years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. Her 22 year old daughter helps her run the business. Her 20 year old son is a security guard. In order to improve her family's living condition, Sakhorn is requesting a loan of USD 400 in order to purchase more groceries to sell to make more profit. By doing so, she will get extra profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her youngest son to study until he gets a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Srorng

texts.en: Srorng, 26 years-old, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She raises ducks at home. Her husband is a TUK TUK (three-wheel vehicle) driver who carries garment workers to the factory. Srorng is requesting a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase a new TUK TUK for her husband to run asa  taxi to generate income to support the family. By doing so, her husband would have a TUK TUK to attract more customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business of duck raising by purchasing more ducks to raise and also to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a new TUK TUK for her husband to run as a taxi.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is a 50 year old, widowed mother of two who lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder son is disabled and the younger one is a student in school. She started her souvenir business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market. Due to the lack of money, her business hasn't expanded much. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It's been hard since my husband passed away. However, I will not give up". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to rent more additional counter in market and to buy supplies.

loans.use: to rent more additional counter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khern

texts.en: Khern, 46, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband is a rice farmer. Due to lower income, Khern is requesting a loan of USD 700 to run a new business by purchasing a new car to run as a taxi. By doing so, her husband will generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase more groceries to sell and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new car to run as a taxi.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is a single mother of four who lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-sumber province, Mongolia. Her eldest kid lives independently, the middle one is a college student and the younger two are school students. 

Erdenetsetseg started her meat retailing business in 1996. Over the years she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her business is stable and very profitable. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "With my income it is hard to support three children. Therefore, I decided to rent another counter in the market". She is requesting 850,000 MNT to purchase more meat.

loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy, 27, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are fish vendors. There is only one source of income to support the family. Therefore, Sophy would like to ask for a loan of USD 700 to purchase a piece of farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling groceries, renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farming land to grow agricultural crops.

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Govi-sumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed and her two kids are kindergarten students. She started her pig farming business in early 2011. She started with only two pigs and now she has 11 pigs. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she has already found a buyer. Her business has potential to grow. However, due to the lack of experience her farm is cold and she is short on food supply. She is requesting 2,800,000 MNT to buy materials for a making the sty warm and to purchase forage for her pigs. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Due to the uncomfortable farming place (sty), my pigs are tired and I'm afraid that if I keep it up this way, I will lose them."

loans.use: To buy materials for making the sty warm and to purchase forage for her pigs

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store at home for over 15 years, has an extensive experience, and is successful in her career. Her husband is a wood trader. In order to expand her husband's business, Yon is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 for her husband to buy more wood to sell. By doing so, her husband will generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a wood shop at home to earn more profit and support her children to study until they get Bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, 30, is married and resides with his wife and one school-aged child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a distiller. Additionally, he raises pigs to generate more income. His wife is a garment worker. Hai is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice to use in wine distilling. By doing so, he would be able to get the rice after distillation to feed his pigs as well. In the future, he plans to expand his distilling business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to use in wine distilling

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a 50-year-old widow with five children; three in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy grocery stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Emma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the whole family.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng, 49, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been a motor taxi driver for over seven years and is successful in his career. His wife is a homemaker. In order to improve his family's living conditions, Peng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials to fix and renew his house to be a comfortable house for his family. In the future, he would like to run a grocery store for his wife to sell at home and support his children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix and renew his house

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Wilma is buying and selling a variety of fish like sardines, mackerel, and trout. She is using their motorela or motorcycle in selling and delivering the fish, and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
Wilma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Ian has a food shop that sells snacks like burgers and spaghetti. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for the making of snacks .
Ian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ian hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the making of snacks

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Ruel is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for gasoline.
Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store at home for over five years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a truck driver. All of her children are still in school. Chenda requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store at the market to sell groceries, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Mr. Meur is 43 years old. He is married with three children living in Takhmao town. But presently, one of his children has started a new family and lives separately. The remaining two are now working in various parts of a garment factory. Mr. Meur has spent most of his lifetime dedicated to an agricultural business. He grows rice and vegetable crops and is able to earn in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day. 

At present, Mr. Meur needs some funds from Kiva through HKL to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides and lubricating oil for his pumping machine. This loan will enable him to keep his crops in good condition and to improve his business. For his goal, he will build a wooden pigpen behind his house and raise some piglets for more income.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides and lubricating oil for his pumping machine.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Angeles has a retail shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra [dried coconut meat used for oil production]. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy coconuts to sell.

Angeles is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Luna has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.

Luna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. Annabel has a retail shop that sells clothes like shirts and blouses, and also blankets and curtains. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of clothes to sell.

Annabel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is married and the mother of four adult children. She 72 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina used her last loan to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan amounting to 18,000 Philippine pesos to pay for the labor costs in charcoal making. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Celso has a barber shop that provides hair cutting and styling for men and women. He has had this business for 28 years. He requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

Celso has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Celso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his barber shop

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Marina has a retail shop that sells toys, clothing and accessories. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Marina is a new member of HSPFI, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more toys, clothing and accessories to sell. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more toys, clothing and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Maria Alipia

texts.en:
Maria Alipia is 46 years old and married with 11 children. She and her family are from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Maria Alipia owns farmland that she has operated for 15 years. She earns PHP 3,000 a month from it. 

In 2007 Maria Alipia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She requested a loan in the amount of 7000Php to purchase banana fertilizers and portion of the loan will also be used banana farm cleaning. Aside from banana production she has also a coco farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ebe

texts.en:
Ebe is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ebe has a retail shop that sells home supplies, office supplies (like scissors and clips) and school supplies (like cellophane covers). She has had this business for 10 years. 

Ebe requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more stock of home, office and school supplies to sell. Ebe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of home, office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lilibeth has a retail shop that sells snacks like cupcakes, rice cakes and milk candies. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Lilibeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun is a 37-year-old married woman who has been residing in Takhmao town. She has been blessed with five single children who depend on her income. Mrs. Khun is in the same business as her husband – they cultivate rice and some kinds of vegetable crops. Together, they are able to make a good income of $8 per day. And now, Mrs. Khun has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase fertilizers to put on her farmland. For her future prospects, she intends to own a few plots of farmland in order to increase her output over the year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to put on her farmland.

loans.name: Chokk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chokk has been living with six single children in Reussey Keo commune in Phnom Penh City. She is now 44 years old, and she cultivates rice crops for her livelihood. Her husband works as a construction worker in different locations around the country. Presently, two of her daughters are working in a garment factory as seamstresses in order to contribute to the family's living situation. 

Mrs. Chokk wants to borrow some funds from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to repair some parts of her house and to buy a used motorcycle to meet the needs of the whole family. Mrs. Chokk plans to provide each of her children with further education, no matter how hard she has to work.

loans.use: to repair some parts of her house and to buy a used motorcycle to meet the needs of the family.

loans.name: Adenium Group

texts.en:
Enni is a widow. She is a mother of four children. Three of her children already finished school and found a job and one of her children is still in college. She has been selling cups of tea since 2010 in front of her house. She also sells cell phone minute refills. Her business is going well and she has a lot of customers. Now she wants to sell a variety of drinks like juice. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy fruit like oranges, guavas, avocados and soursops to produce fruit juice to sell together with the tea.

In the future, she wants to keep expanding her business and if possible, she wants to add more variety of drinks. She also hopes she can keep on maintaining her child's tuition fees for college.

Other group members plan to use their part of the loan to sell Tupperware on credit, to sell perfume and to sell snacks.

loans.use: to pay for fruits like orange, guava, avocado and soursop to produce fruit juice

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 56 years old and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult children.

Teofila has a general store in progress. Teofila, at this time, is operating her other business venture, raising crops, particularly corn. She has been in this business 20 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

In 2007, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her cornfield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, married, is the mother of three children. She is 46 years old, and lives at Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Sarah plants and harvests corn for sale to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 24 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2004, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sarah wants to make improvements to her house, and to enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is married with two children. Leslie is 24 years-old, and lives in Liposong Ozamis City, Philippines.

He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to the local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years, and every month he earns PHP 2,000.00 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to repair his existing vehicle to provide a better service.

In 2010, Leslie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Leslie hopes for his children to finish their studies, and to gain double the income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children. 

Merlinda owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a thirty-eight year-old hard working man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are educating his children, buying a car, and building a permanent home. He has been a farmer for the last three years; the major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase farming equipment. However, he has a vision of diversifying his farming business to include hiring employees to help expand the the farm, and buying more cattle. The purpose of the loan is to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Lanie Jean

texts.en:
Lanie Jean is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Lanie Jean is married and has one infant. 

To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Lanie Jean has been in her business for two years, and earns PHP 3000 a month from this activity. 

In 2009, Lanie Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie Jean is requesting a loan of PHP 6,300 which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 48 years old, and is married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dioscora has a recycled materials retail business in the Philippines. Dioscora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Dioscora has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support her family. Elvie is married and sells ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Elvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses, pants etc. to sell. 

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Rhesa

texts.en:
Rhesa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Rhesa has a retail shop that sells cell phone accessories and also rents movies on DVD. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of phone accessories and also DVDs.

Rhesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rhesa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of phone accessories and buy DVDs to rent.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anita provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy the products she needs for her service, such as nail polish.

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as nail polish that she needs for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Liposong Ozamis City. She is 57 years old. Lilia is a widow and has seven children. 

To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells cassava and coconut to local community members. Lilia has been in her business for 15 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Micheal Angelo

texts.en:
Micheal Angelo is a 25-year-old single man, living in Bacolod, Ozamis City: Philippines.

To earn a living, Micheal Angelo runs a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community. He has been doing this for 15 years, and each month it earns him PHP 3,600. 

He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Micheal Angelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Micheal Angelo's objective is to save money to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Paskwalina

texts.en:
Paskwalina is aged 43 and is the mother of two children, a 17 and a 15 year old. Both of them are in school. She has been in active farming for ten consecutive years and currently produces tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages which she sells to the local markets.

Paskwalina has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds to start a venture into poultry farming. This is her third loan request. The first was for 45,000 KES and the second for 80,000 KES. She hopes the new venture will boost her farming income to enable her service the loan and educate her children.

She laments the high costs of farm inputs and diseases as the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with six children. 

Loreto has a souvenir shop that sells souvenirs made from sea shells. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

Loreto is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Loreto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a forty-nine-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years, and the major hardship is price fluctuations and inflation. However, she has a vision of expanding her business into new areas.

The purpose of the loan is to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married and has four children. 

Julieta owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Julieta has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 7,900 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is from Bacolod, Ozamiz city. She is 51 years old. Pricilla is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Pricilla plants, harvests and sells rice on land which she owns. Pricilla has been involved in this business for 15 years, and makes PHP 3,000 a month from her work. 

In 2007, Pricilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pricilla is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lorijun

texts.en:
Lorijun is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Lorijun has a souvenir shop that sells souvenirs made from sea shells. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

Lorijun is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lorijun hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to make souvenirs.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a forty one year old single mother with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and buy a car. 

She has been involved in selling fish for ten years. The major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase modern equipment. However, Miria has a vision of expanding her business into new areas and hiring employees to help her expand her business.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a boat engine.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Luzvilla has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and printed blouses. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

Luzvilla is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luzvilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jusilene

texts.en:
Jusilene is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jusilene has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jusilene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jusilene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is from Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Hazel is married and has five children. 

To make a living, she owns and operate a business venture, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Hazel has been in her business for ten years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel is requesting a loan of 7,050 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Lizabee

texts.en:
Lizabee is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Lizabee owns and operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. She's been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 5,000 from the business. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to repair one of the vehicles which is used in the business. 

In 2011, Lizabee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lizabee hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle she uses for her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Petronila has a shop that sells a variety of snacks like tikoy (rice cakes), butsi (red bean sesame seed balls) and sugar coated nuts. She has had this business for twenty-one years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Petronila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Petronila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Camelo is a fisherman and sells his catch to the local community in the public market. He has been doing this for twelve years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy materials he needs for fishing.

Camelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Camelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials he needs for fishing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has two children aged two and twelve years. She describes herself as friendly and caring woman. 

She sells clothes, shoes, earrings and necklaces to new and repeat customers. She has been in this business for the last four years. 

She describes her business challenge to be high price of shoes. She will be using the KES 10,000 loan to buy belts, clothes, rings, earrings and necklaces. 

In the next five years, Caroline dreams to venture into new business of exporting shoes to Uganda.

loans.use: To buy belts, clothes, rings, earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 25 years old and has a common-law husband and one child.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries. 

Rowena has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Rowena aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working lady with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to buy a car. 

She has been operating a pub for three years and the major hardship is high rent and transportation costs. However, she has a vision of expanding her business into new markets.

The purpose of the loan is to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Phyjesmael

texts.en:
Phyjesmael is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Phyjesmael provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and the gasoline he needs for the service. 

Phyjesmael has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Phyjesmael hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and the gasoline he needs for his business.

loans.name: Joesica

texts.en:
Joesica is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Joesica has a retail shop that sells vegetables like ampalaya, squash and string beans. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Joesica is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joesica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a forty-one-year-old married lady with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home.

She has been selling clothes for twenty years after having starting with a capital of only 27,000 UGX. The major hardships are price fluctuations and high transportation costs. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location and expanding into new markets.

The purpose of the loan is to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monicah is aged 44 and the mother of three school-aged children. She lives in Nkubu in Central Kenya. 

She has been involved in farming for 20 years. She sells her produce: maize, beans, cabbages and potatoes on the local market. In addition to farming, Monicah operates a retail shop. Her farm employs three farmhands. 

Monicah has made a third loan request of 60,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to enable her construct a zero grazing unit (an indoor facility for cattle) for her dairy cows. She duly paid her previous loans which were of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES. She says the loan will help her add more dairy cows and improve their production and also to educate her children. Her focus is to own rental houses in the future.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services but laments the high costs of farm inputs and the damage caused by pests.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goals are to educate his children and building a permanent residential house. He has been distilling alcohol for the last five years after starting with a capital of fifty thousand only, but now his business is worth two millions. The major hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to set up a liquor store in town. David needs the loan facility to buy bananas for distilling alcohol.

loans.use: to buy bananas so as to distill alcohol.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty-nine-year-old hardworking lady with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house. She has been in a retail shop business for the period of three years, and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent area. The purpose of the loan is to buy eggs and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Keng, 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Keng has been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her business. She is involved in growing rice and breeding livestock. 

Her husband has been working as a carpenter for over 8 years to generate income to feed the family. Keng wants to improve her family's living conditions and support her children's education until they finish college. With this goal in mind, Keng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will generate extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband's carpentry business by hiring more people to help her husband manufacture more furniture to sell to his clients. Moreover, she plans to renew her house and decorate the interior to be more attractive and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old and is married with four children ranging from six to twenty-four years. She describes herself as determined and visionary. She has been into poultry farming where she sells chickens, meat and manure. Her business challenge is the high cost of chicken feeds and the outbreak of diseases. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more chickens. In the next five years, Josephine hopes and dreams to be a supplier.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a thirty-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and self-education. He has been a liquor dealer for the last two years. The major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 39, is a farmer as well as a Khmer noodle seller who carries her noodles and its soup with a yoke, going through the village every day. She typically earns an average of $5.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has been blessed with a single child, who is studying in grade 9 in a local public junior high school in the Baray district. 

In the past, she used to buy stocks of rice from local farmers after harvesting season to store it up for her future business. However, she won’t be able to keep this business running without sufficient capital. Thus, Mao would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase stocks of rice for future sale, when its market demand increases. In the future, she hopes to expand this business, and she wants to be the owner of a big stock of rice in the province.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice for future sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 54 years old and married with four children. He owns a cattle buying and selling business. He faces a challenge of high price fluctuations. He started the business from savings he made from his salary as a teacher. His family goal is to educate his children, and his business goal is to expand his business to new markets. John needs a loan to buy cattle to sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is 27 years old and a single mother of four children. She owns a secondhand clothing business which she has been running for 4 years now. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations. Her family goal is to educate her children, and her business dream is to expand to new markets. She intends to use to loan to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 29 years old, and is married with three children.

For three years, she has had a business selling shoes and clothes. She is a teacher by profession and she saved her salary to start the business. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital and her family goal is to educate her children.

She intends to use the loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rhodesia

texts.en:
Rhodesia 40 years old. She is married and has four children ranging from fifteen to twenty four. She describes herself as social and friendly woman. 

She has been selling goats for the last five years. Her primary customers are butcher shops and passers-by. Her business challenge is inadequate funds to improve her business. 

She will be using the KES 15,000 loan to buy more goats. In the next five years, Rhodesia hopes to run a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: At this time, Gantsetseg wants to expand her sales volume by raising working capital. This will contribute to the future improvement of her business. She will use this additional loan to purchase groceries so that she will be able to increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old married man with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a milk business. He started with 20 liters but now he supplies up to 600 liters a week.

He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and his business goal is to expand to new markets. His family goal is to educate his children and he also hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

Robert intends to use the loan to buy a freezer to preserve milk.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to preserve milk.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married father of 6 children. He lives in his own house and has no other dependents. His goal for his family is to educate his children.

He is a crop farmer and has been farming for quite some time. He faces a challenge of seasonal variations which affects his crop yields and his dream is to venture into better methods of farming. Peter needs a loan to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 48 years old and is in the business of raising hogs in Baray district. She generates approximately $6.00 each day through the business. 

Mrs. Chea has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years. She has gained good experience from it and is able to manage her work well to keep her pigs from illness and to keep them clean.

Mrs. Chea has five children, two of whom are married, while the remaining three are now working. With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will use it to purchase a used motorbike for her three employed children to commute to their workplaces. For her business goal, she plans to expand her farmland and increase her output for both her own daily food use and for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Weyenga

texts.en:
Weyenga is 65 years old, married and has nine children ranging from nine and thirty years. He describes himself as a quiet and social man. He provides laundry services to policemen. He has been in this business for the last fifteen years. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the laundry services.

He will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy a dry cleaner. In the next five years, Weyenga hopes and dreams to expand his business by employing people in the business.

loans.use: To buy a dry cleaner

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a twenty-two-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house.

He has been dealing in the coffee trade for one year and his major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of moving his business to a more permanent location and owning a coffee store that can supply the whole district.The purpose of the loan is to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a hardworking married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, is a farmer who also operates a motorcycle for a living. Joseph's family goal is the education of his children, and his business goal is the cultivation of his banana plantation so that he becomes a model farmer. He faces the challenges limited labor force to cultivate his banana plantation. Joseph needs the loan to pay workers who are cultivating his banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his banana plantation

loans.name: Rinorah

texts.en:
Rinorah is a hard-working lady living in Kasese, Uganda, and her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been running a retail shop for the last two years after starting with working capital of fifty thousand only from her farming activities which she did initially.
