Her major hardship is customers not paying on time, however, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married. 

Rosario owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rosario has been in her business for six years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Rosario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married and has six children ranging from fifteen to twenty-six years. She describes herself as a sociable and friendly woman. She has been selling clothes for the last five years. In addition, she also does farming to add to her income. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the clothing retail store. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy  more ladies' clothes. In the next five years, Josephine dreams of and plans to run a boutique near her town.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh, 33 years old, is married and a father of four daughters. He is a worker who earns a decent salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. Saleh and his family are suffering in the winter season from water entering the house, so he wants to make some necessary repairs to his house such as repairing the ceilings, changing doors and windows, painting, etc. So Saleh is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of repairing the house. This will improve the house and offer the family better living conditions. Saleh is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for repairing his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Altan-Erdene

texts.en:
Altan-Erdene is a 24-year-old guy who lives with his spouse and brother-in-law in the outer ger (yurt) district without basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He supports his family by operating a transportation business between UB city and the south border. 

Before he started his business he worked as a doorman at a local industrial company. When his labor contract finished he started his current business.  During the business season he must accommodate the south province, because he has many competitors, and the man who can get up early is able to earn more money than others. 

He has no problem accommodating the south province of Mongolia except his place for living accommodation is far away, therefore he needs to buy a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, so he can live closer. 

Thus, he is requesting a 1.400.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a ger to live in near the south border of Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase a ger (yurt) to live in

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en: Mrs. Hourn, 41, owns a liquor store and sells foods like grilled beef and other kinds of meat to her customers who need them while drinking liquor. From this business, she is able to generate an income of $3.50 per day. She has only one child who is already married. Nowadays, Hourn’s husband completely manages all farming work and also takes some time to raise some piglets at home. This couple has tried very hard because they want to attain a good quality of life and have a comfortable living. Mrs. Hourn would like to request her first loan from HKL and Kiva to buy 20 heads of piglets and pig feed to sustain the business and thereby increase her household income. She is very happy and grateful for the support for her family-owned businesses.

loans.use: to buy 20 heads of piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Tumf

texts.en: Tum, 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a porridge vendor. Her husband is a fish paste vendor. Two of her children are garment workers. Tum is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to run a poultry farm and support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her home and build a bathroom

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is married and has three children. Jelyn is 21 years old and resides in Calabayan Ozamis City. 

Jelyn is engaged in raising and selling pigs. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

In 2010, Jelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jelyn wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. She is 26 years old. Michelle is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a business venture, making and selling barbecue in the local community. Michelle has been in her business for five years and earns 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Michelle is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods such as hot dogs to sell. In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 46-year-old widow and entrepreneur who lives with her five children in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Monngolia, without basic infrastructure. Two of her children attend local high school and institute. The other three are working at the Wagner Asia company. 

From  2005 to 2009 she worked as a chef. After that she supported her family by operating a cosmetics sales business at the local small indoor market. She has 1,800,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She rents one small stall and sells a wide range of cosmetic products such as hair colors, shampoos, toothpastes, hair gels, toilet tissues, wet tissues, face creams, etc. 

After the Christmas and New Year holidays, her business needs money to purchase more products in order to increase working capital. Thus, she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cosmetic products to sell in her stall.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 37 years old and married to Kiptanui and they have one child. 

She operates an M-pesa (mobile phone money transfer) service and has been in the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is requesting her third loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd. She plans to use the funds to increase the cash float(the minimum amount of  cash  required in an account of each dealer by the mobile money transfer operator)   for her business. The anticipated profits she will plough back into the business and repay the loan.

Her hopes are to open another branch and have a happy family.

loans.use: To increase the  cash float requiredment for her M pesa  business (mobile phone money transfer service).

loans.name: Phalleang

texts.en:
Phalleang, 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in agricultural for over 20 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their business. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle to use as well as to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. 

Phalleang wants to improve her family’s livelihood and build a fence around her house. With this goal in mind, Phalleang is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate extra income to financially support the family. Moreover, she would like to support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more farming land to grow agricultural crops.

loans.name: Panda Group

texts.en:
Ika is a widow. She has one child. Her child is 10 years old and still at school. 

She has been selling daily basic needs such as sugar, oil and rice since 2009 from her house. The business is going well but she needs more money to have more variation of goods. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use her part of loan to buy more sugar, oil and gas. The income that she gets, she will use to fulfill her and her child's daily basic needs and also to pay school fess. 

There are also challenges that she faces like competitors, and sometimes her customers owe her. 

In the future, she wants to have her own store separated from the house. She also wants to have enough savings to give her child a good education even until university.

Other group members will use their parts of the loan to expand their businesses, which sell snacks and clothes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more sugar, oil and gas.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. One of her children is also a construction worker who works with his father. 

Due to the lack of construction materials, Uk is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more construction materials for her husband to run his business to be a construction foreman. By doing so, her husband will generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase construction material for her husband to run his business to be a construction foreman.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 39 years old, married, has five children and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by planting and harvesting coconuts. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,850 to buy seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In 2007, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her life. Rosa's goal for the future is to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a coconut farm.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old, married to Nelius, and they are blessed with one child. He has been running a beauty salon for the past 3 years with the monthly income of 6,500 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Samuel will use the loan to buy cosmetics for his salon. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for his salon

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 57 years old, married to Agnes, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past 3 years with a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a widow with two children. She is 49 years old, residing in Calabayan Ozamis City. 

Lourdes owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb is 40 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling breakfast food (porridge, fried pork rice, fried chicken rice and other items) and by farming. Her husband is a primary school teacher and her daughter is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy cattle to help with her farming. In the future, she plans to grow mixed vegetables to generate more income to support her family, improve her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en: Albanus is 29 years old, married and the father of one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living by farming and now earns about Kes 9,000 a month. He is applying for his third loan from KADET Ltd., for Kes 30,000, to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to earn enough money to be able to send his child to school. His goal for the future is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is 52, married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice and raising pigs. One of her children earns a living as a garment worker. In order to improve her family's life, she is applying for a loan for $500 to buy more piglets to raise and sell. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her herd so she can earn enough money to improve her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is 34 years old, single and the mother of one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling soft drinks and now earns about Kes 20,000 a month, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for Kes 30,000, to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers. She will use the additional profits she earns to educate her child. Her goal for the future is to increase her income by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 42 years old, married, and has five children between 3 and 25 years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She has been involved in a tree-planting agriculture business for the last year. She sells tree seedlings. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the tree plantation. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more tree seeds for planting. In the next five years, Lucy hopes to be selling seedlings wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more tree seeds

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mr. Lun, age 39, is a humble farmer who has spent most his life planting rice and vegetable crops in Baray district. His wife is in the same business as him and always assists him in planting the crops to generate income for the whole family. This couple has been blessed with four children. Two of his children are attending a local primary school. Lun intends to raise some piglets in his backyard in order to improve his family's standard of living.

At this time, for his second loan from Kiva, Lun is asking for 2,800,000 KHR to buy some piglets, pig feed, and a pumping machine for his crops. He hopes that he’ll be able to uplift his family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy some piglets, pig feed, and a pumping machine for crops.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old. She is married to Sospeter and they have two children. She raises poultry for resale at their farm in Kosirai. Her business has been in operation for two years, and she earns a monthly income of 8,500 KES.

She is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more poultry specifically for egg production.  The profits will be used to increase the number of poultry in the farm and to repay the loan. Her hopes are to venture into large-scale farming and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Tutor Jaya Group

texts.en:
Nuryanih is pictured in the middle wearing a blue jacket. Nuryanih is married. She is a mother of three children. They are Fajar, Satrio and Wiji. All of them are still going to school. She has been selling crickets since 2010. The business is going well but she needs a cage to accomomdate the cricket's harvest. That is why she is taking her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use her part of the loan to make a cage for her cricket's harvest. She likes to run this business because when the harvest time comes, she does not have any competitors. Income from her business can help her husband who is a policeman to prepare their daily basic needs.

In the future, she wants to keep expanding her business and she hopes she can continuously give her children a better education even until university.

The other group members will use their part of the loan to expand their businesses, which include selling vegetables, selling snacks and running a beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make a cricket cage

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 52 years old and married to Nelius. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET for KES 20,000. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child.

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Siprose

texts.en: Siprose is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 8 years to 12 years old. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a a grocey store where she sells tomatoes, onions, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery store. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes, kale and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more kale, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and has two sons. She describes herself as a good and principled woman. She has been providing tailoring services for the last two years. She sells clothes such as trousers, shirts, and skirts to new and frequent customers. Her business challenge is the high cost of material used for sewing clothes. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more materials to make clothes. In the next five years, Elizabeth hopes to run a bigger dressmaking shop.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sewing.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old, married to Dorcas, and blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the last six years and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET in the amount of KES 30,000. He plans to use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers. With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan. He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer.

His hopes are to venture into large scale farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Sarann, 60, is widowed and resides with a daughter and a son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a weaver. Her daughter is a garment worker and her son is a construction worker. Due to less income, Sarann is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase cattle to breed in order generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to generate more income

loans.name: Onesmas

texts.en: Onesmas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a good and principled man. He operates a Nissan with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy town. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay to have his Nissan repaired. His business goal is to be the best transport provider within five years.

loans.use: To pay to repair his Nissan.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 40 years old married to Veronica and they have four children.  He has been into the dairy farming business for the last seven years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 20,000,which he will use to buy dairy feeds and veterinary medicines for his dairy cow.  He paid back his previous loan well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

His hopes are to venture in large scale farming and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and veterinary medicine for his cow.

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Tizo is in his late twenties and is single with one child .  He has been running a barber shop for three years now.  He works from 7am to 8pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Tizo’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   He used the previous loan to increase  the stock of his barber shop business and has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to add more stock to his barber shop business.  Tizo’s dream is to one day build his own house.

Tizo will share this loan with his loan group, "Dove", which totals fourteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add more stock to his barber shop business.

loans.name: Putri Jaya Group

texts.en:
Hapazoh is a mother of three children. One of her children is still in school. She has been selling merchandise like sugar, eggs and drinks for five years. The business is running smoothly. The income that she gets can contribute to the income from her husband as a laborer to provide their daily basic needs.  She plans to use her part of the loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, eggs, and snacks to sell in her store. In the future, she wants to have a bigger store. She also hopes her child can get an education through college.

Other group member businesses are selling cell phone minute refills and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, drinks, eggs, and snacks to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 23 years old, single and blessed with one child.  She also supports her mother.  She sells used clothing in Bonjoge trading centre and has been in operation for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 10,000.  She plans to use the funds to purchase a bale of used clothing for resale.  With the anticipated profits she will plough back and purchase more stock of second hand clothing for resale.

Her dream is to open a clothes boutique and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mirzotochiddin

texts.ru: Мирзоточиддин умный, честный, перспективный молодой человек. Ему 21 лет. Он хорошо учился в школе и с таким успехом продолжает учебу в ВУЗ-е. Он всегда старается быть в курсе всех новостей в учебе и постоянно расширяет свой кругозор и занимается самообразованием. Он целеустремленный он хочет с отличием закончить университет, и продолжает учебу в аспирантуре, а также мечтает работать в престижном банке с этой целью он хотел бы получить займ, чтобы оплатить сумму годового обучения в Университете.
texts.en: Mirzotochiddin is a smart, honest and promising young man.  He is 21 years old.  He studied well in school and continues his education at a higher education facility with this same success.  He always tries to be up-to-date with all the educational news and constantly expands his outlook, and teaches himself too.  He is goal-oriented and wants to graduate from the university with distinction, and continue studying in a masters program, and also dreams of working at a prestigious bank.  Mirzotochiddin wants to obtain this loan to achieve his goals and pay for the annual cost of education at the University.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Kaingi

texts.en: Kaingi is a 42-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years old. She describes herself to be quiet and humble. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery store. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more potatoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of potatoes in large quantities within five years.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa extracts palm kennel oil to sell. In addition, she sells gari near Elmina. Adjoa is married to a farmer and has six children. Adjoa   has been in this business for eight years.  She uses her income to assist her husband with the upkeep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase more gari for sale and palm kennel for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more gari and palm kennel

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married to Mark and they have three children. She has been in the business of selling curtain nets and clothing materials for the last six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 30,000. She plans to use the funds to buy more stock of curtain nets and clothing materials. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a large clothing store and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy curtain nets and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 44-year old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 9 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a retail shop where she sells food products such as wheat flour, sugar, rice, salt, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat. Monica's business goal is to be a wholesaler in her town area within five years.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sinar Jaya Group

texts.en:
Jumiyem is 39 years old. She is married with two children. They are 17 years old and 10 years old. They are still going to school. Jumiyem has been selling snacks for more than 20 years. The business is going well but she needs more money to buy more ingredients to produce more snacks to sell. That is why she is taking a loan from VisionFund Indonesia. The income that she gains can add to the income from her husband as a driver to prepare food for the family. She likes to run this business because she likes to cook and make snacks.

In the future, she wants to expand her business and have a kiosk. She also wants to repair her house. 

Other group members are selling clothes on credit and selling food.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to produce snacks to sell

loans.name: Channov's Group

texts.en:
A 44-year-old mother of one dependent child who is still in school, Channov is also a farmer who has been farming for 20 years to earn a living in her village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She has been supplementing her income by raising pigs for five years to gain additional income to better support her family. With her current business, she earns around US $2 per day and saves around US $1.50 daily. 

Now Channov leads a group of four female members. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs for US$50. She hopes to feed her pigs to be healthy and earn more income to improve her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a 38-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 7 years to 26 years old. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a retail shop where she sells wheat flour, maize flour, maize, beans, cooking fat etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located near a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her retail shop. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and cooking fat. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and has been in active farming for 30 years with her current farm produce of maize, beans and tobacco going to the local market. She is age 53 and married with nine children. All her children are adults save for the last born who is age 12 and still schooling. Besides farming, Rose takes care of elderly people in one of their local homes.

Rose has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats for a venture into dairy farming. She adds that the income from the dairy business will take care of the education of the last-born child in addition to providing for other basic needs.

She sees animal diseases as the main challenge coupled with high input costs.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sokchea is 27 years old and single. She is a garment factory worker and she has been in this job for five years to make a living. 

Sokchea has been with VisionFund for five years. The loans from VisionFund have helped her have sufficient food to eat and make a living better. Now she leads a group consisting of four female members in the village to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Sokchea will use the entire loan to buy construction materials i.e. cement, zinc, wood etc to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent and better house to live in.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a single parent and has one child. Ama sells meat and crab near Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Ama uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay the school fees of her child. Ama will use her loan to buy more meat and crabs for sale. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat and crabs to sell

loans.name: Sineth's Group

texts.en:
Sineth is 49 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are dependents. She lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. Sineth is a farmer who also plants cassava to generate additional income. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more than $10 per day to feed her family.

Sineth has been with VisionFund since 2008 and prior loans have helped her make a living better.  Sineth and her group member, who has also been with VisionFund since 2008, are requesting another loan. Sineth will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are charcoal, salted fish, tomatoes and other food items at Benyadze near Elmina.  She is a single parent with 6 dependents. Ama uses her income for the general upkeep of her dependents. Ama will use her loan to purchase salt, charcoal salted fish, tomatoes and other food items for sale. Wih her new profit Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase salt, charcoal salted fish, tomatoes and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for her kenkey (fermented corn dough) production.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district, Chreb is a 41-year-old mother of five children. Two of the children work to support the others and to make a living while the other three are still in school. She is a farmer who has been growing rice for twenty years. She also plants cassava and sometimes works for others to raise additional income. 

Chreb is a second cycled client who has been with VisionFund since 2010. The loan from VisionFund has helped her have sufficient food and regular income. Now requesting another loan, she will use the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthfully and increase crop yield to earn more income. She also hopes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale and palm kernel for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married to a capernter and lives with their 4 children at Benkyadze near Elmina. Araba sells doughnut and maize porridge which she has done for some time now. Araba uses her income to support her husband and to pay utility bills. Araba will use her loan to purchase flour and maize for the preparation of her doughnut and maize porridge to sell. Araba will expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase flour and maize for the preparation of her doughnut and maize porridge to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural area located in Ponhea Krek district, Sopheap now is 52 years old and has six children, four of whom are dependents who are workers and still in school. She is a farmer in the village and has been planting cassava for more than three years to support her family. 

Sopheap received a loan from VisionFund three years ago. The loan helped her make a living better. She currently earns ten U.S. dollars per day but is able to save less than US$4 daily. Now she is requesting another loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She hopes to grow healthy cassava plants and make a living even better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, 30, is married and has only one child who is too young to attend school. She is a farmer and she also raises ducks to make a living while her husband is a worker at a rubber plantation factory. She has been with her business for six years. 

Chanthy has been with VisionFund since 2010. She used a loan from VisionFund to make her living better. Now she earns more than US$10 per day and saves less than eight U.S. dollars daily. Now she is applying for another loan and she wants to buy more duck babies with the entire loan for her business. This loan will enable her to have more ducks to expand her business and she hopes to increase her family's income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more material  to sew.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua extracts   palm kennel oil for sale and she also sells "gari" (cassava couscous) at Benkyadze near Elmina.  Akosua  is married to a farmer   and has six children.  Akosua   has been into this business for 8 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the up-keep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale and palm kennels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale and palm kennels for the extraction of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize for the preparation of her "Akyikie" for sale.

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
A villager from Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common, Chandy is thirty years old and has only one daughter who is not yet school aged. She is a farmer and also plants cassava as her primary business. She has been in this business for ten years. Furthermore, she raises pigs to gain additional income. 

Chandy is a client who has already received two loans and has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loans have helped her make a living better. She currently earns five U.S. dollars per day and saves more than US$1 daily. Now requesting another loan, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice farm. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and increase crop yield so as to earn a larger income to set aside some money to finish her house renovation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby  is a single parent with four children. They live at Beneyase near Elmina. Baby sells meat which she has done for some time now.  As a single parent she uses her income to clothe, feed and pay her children’s school fees. Baby will use her loan to purchase more meat for sale.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her to get a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen in a village located in Ponhea Krek district, Chhoeun, aged 38, is a farmer and she has been in this primary business for eighteen years. Her husband, 44, is a worker at a furniture handicraft in the village. She has three dependent children and now they work at a cassava factory and also work for others for pay to earn a living. With her current income source, Chhoeun earns less than US$10 per day to feed her family but she is able to save around five U.S. dollars daily. 

Applying for her first loan with VisionFund, Chhoeun is also leading a group of three members. She will use the loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crop. This loan will enable her to have a stock of rice ready for consumption and for sale to generate income to support her family better.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her rice crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 29 years old, married and has an only child who is too young to attend school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cassava as her main income source for more than two years. Sometimes, she works for others to raise additional income. With her current business, she earns less than US$4 per day and is able to set aside around two U.S. dollars daily. 

Chantha has just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle while her group member Oun has been with VisionFund for one year. She is leading this group of two members to apply for a loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland. This loan will enable her to grow healthy cassava plants and she hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr:
Madame Dior, âgée  de 52 ans  mariée et mère de famille  fait du commerce depuis deux ans .Son activité consiste  à acheter  des céréales  du mil surtout  pour le revendre dans le marché.
Elle est une habituée du crédit car elle est  à son septième prêt  qui lui à permet de mettre en place son petit commerce.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter 600 kilogrammes de mil à 150fcfa le kilo, plus le transport à dix mille francs. Avec les bénéfices de son activité elle va réinvestir  dans son activité et élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
Dior, 52, is married and has children. She has been doing business for 2 years: she buys millet which she resells at the market. 
She is no stranger to loan cycles since this is her 7th loan, which enables her to develop her business.
With this loan, she will buy 600 kg of millet at a rate of 150 CFA per kilo, plus transportation (10 000 CFA). With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and expand it.

loans.use: to buy cereals, mostly millet

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité "Primavera" esta en 2º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, esta integrada por 21 señoras. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad en el grupo para llegar al nivel máximo. Muchas señoras lograron iniciar y aumentar sus actividades, gracias a la oportunidad brindada y mediante la confianza.
Una de las miembros es la señora Cynthia, quien nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y cuenta que le va muy bien, por que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, lo que leo trae muy buenos ingresos. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande donde poder ofrecer la leche que vende.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación para la compra de leche y de esa forma poder abastecerse y tener para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" ("Spring") is in its second year of the program of communal banks of female entrepreneurs, and it is composed of 21 women.  The goal of the entrepreneurs is teamwork, fostering the spirit of solidarity, and maintaining group unity in order to reach the highest level.  Many women were able to create or improve their business, thanks to the opportunity provided and through trust.

One of the members is Cynthia, who tells us that she works every day beginning very early in the morning.  She sells milk, and she tells us that the business is going well because she already has many customers, which brings her a good income.  Her dream is to be able to have a big business where she can offer the milk that she sells.  

She requests help from Kiva and from the Foundation to buy milk, stock up, and, in doing so, meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a 37-year-old single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself as a good and principled woman. She operates a pub where she sells beer. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of beer. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more beer. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more beer.

loans.name: Vy'a Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité "Vy´a Aty"se originó a traves de promociones  realizadas en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Ellas  ven en el programa de la fundación, una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias.
La sra Celia, es Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja como empleada domestica por la mañana y por la tarde abre su salón de peluquería, que tiene en su casa, también en su tiempo libre hace manicura y pedicura a domicilio. Su deseo es seguir progresando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esmaltes para uñas, spray, gel, tintes y demás insumos con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Vy'a Aty communal bank originated through promotions carried out in the neighborhood.  All the members are from the same area, acquaintances and neighbors from the neighborhood.  The goal of each one is to work, to promote a spirit of solidarity, and to achieve the highest level of the program.  They see the program as a foundation, a great help to them and their families.

Celia is the president of the group.  She works as a domestic employee in the morning and in the afternoon she opens her hair salon that she has in her house.  In her free time she also does manicures and pedicures at home.  Her desire is to continue making progress and in this way be able to continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy nail polish, hairspray, gel, dyes, and other supplies with which to stock her business and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, hairspray, gel, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон семейный имеет 4-х  детей. Жена домохозяйка. Для содержания своей семьи он занимается выращиванием винограда и откормом скота. Раньше он работал в колхозе бригадиром. В настоящее время бизнес приносит доходы. Но для получения большей прибыли ему хотелось бы приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота и концентратного корма для них. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is a family man with four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  To support his family, he is involved in growing grapes and fattening up livestock.  He previously worked as a foreman.  The business currently yields profits, but Abdurahmon wants to purchase several heads of small livestock and concentrated feed for them in order to make a larger profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni and relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 51-year-old married man. He has six children whose ages range from seven years to 25 years. He describes himself as social and talkative. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 32 years. His business is located near a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more clothes. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Muthoni

texts.en: Muthoni is a married woman. She has seven children whose ages range from 20 years to 34 years. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy and strategic market. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more maize. Muthoni's business goal is to be a supplier in a nearby town within five years.

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a married woman. She has four children whose ages range from four years to 23 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store where she sells oranges, mangoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve the store. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruits, such as mangoes. Olive's business goal is to expand her business by adding more stock of fruit within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of fruits such as mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has three children whose ages range from three months to six years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail supply business where he sells sugar. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic and highly populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar for supply.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Francisco"se originó a traves de promociones  que realizó una de las asesoras en la zona. Todas las integrantes son conocidas y vecinas del barrio, y se unieron con mucha esperanza de que por medio del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación puedan salir adelante.
La sra Fabriciana es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comestibles, como ser sándwich, croquetas, empanadas y demás. Gracias a que tiene muy buenas manos para la cocina tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compran de ella. Su meta es poder tener un local donde ofrecer los alimentos que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito, para la compra de carne, pollo, jamón, queso, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para hacer los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The San Francisco communal bank originated through promotions that the advisors made in the zone.  All of the members are neighbors who know each other.  They got together with a great deal of hope that they would be able to get ahead through the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women with the Fundación. 

Fabriciana is one of the members of the group.  She tells us that she sells all types of food like sandwiches, croquettes, empanadas, and others.  Thanks to the fact that she has a gift for cooking, she has good clientele who always buy from her.  Her goal is to be able to have a place where she can sell the food she makes.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, baked goods, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, condiments, baked goods, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman. She has two children, aged five years and 12 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics such as weaves, Cutex, and hair oil. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cosmetics such as weaves, braids, and hair oil. Martha's business goal is to expand her retail store by adding more cosmetics within five years.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics such as weaves, hair oil, and braids.

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel Arcangel es el gupo integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de San Ignacio. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya na gran ayuda para poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
La sra Isidora, es Presidenta del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la  venta de chipa (similar al pan, alimento muy típico en Paraguay) que a diario sale a vender por el barrio. Comenta que es un trabajo muy agotador, pero que igual le gusta mucho lo que hace, puesto que es un trabajo digno y decoroso. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y seguir manteniendo su hogar, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de harina de maíz, almidón, manteca, huevos, anís y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar las chipas que vende a diario.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Arcangel group is comprised of ten women from the city of San Ignacio.  They are very hard-working and tenacious people.  They have seen that the Committee of Enterprising Women of the Fundación Paraguay is a tremendous help in order to be able to keep growing and helping their families.

Isidora is the president of the group.  She says that she sells “chipa” (similar to bread and a very typical food in Paraguay).  She goes to sell in her neighborhood every day.  She says that it is exhausting work, but she really likes what she does because it is dignified and decent work.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing and supporting her household.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy corn flour, starch, butter, eggs, anise, and the rest of the ingredients that she needs to make the chipas that she sells every day.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, starch, butter, eggs, anise, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 20 years. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a a farm where she sells vegetables such as kale. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a tarmac road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more seeds. Millicent's business goal is to own a greenhouse within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more kale seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 13 years. He describes himself as determined. He operates a motorbike transportation service. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the harsh business environment imposed by the local authority. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy an additional motorbike. Joseph's  goal is to improve his business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano" surgió gracias a promociones hecha en la zona por una de las asesoras de la fundación, son 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se unieron con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras.  Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel, por medio de su trabajo.
 Lucila es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de pollos y luego los vende. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y también cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría y también alimentos para estos, para que de esa forma ella pueda aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank originated through promotions that the advisors made in the zone.  They are 11 very hard-working and tenacious women who united in order to work together.  Through this work they help each other.

They are currently in their second cycle of the program, and they wish to be able to reach the highest level through their work.

Lucila is a very hard-working and self-sacrificing woman.  She tells us that she raises chickens and then sells them.  Through this work she has been able to get ahead and help her family.  She also covers the day to day expenses that arise.

She is requesting the loan to buy baby chickens to raise. She will also buy feed for them.  This way she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en: Gordon is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as optimistic and jovial. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located near his town. He describes his biggest business challenge as restricted access to Kisumu town centre, where many of his customers are. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy spare wheels for his motorcycle. Gordon's business goal is to own several motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more spare wheels.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Roseline is a 38-year-old widow who has four dependent children. She has operated a retail business where she sells new clothes in Bondo town, Western Kenya, for the last 16 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 13,000.

She is requesting for her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy more new clothing and school bags to sell.

Her hopes are to grow her business through the help of KADET loans and also to provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes and school bags.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias.
La Sra Jacinta es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, nos comenta que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tiene muy buena venta, por los productos de buena calidad que ofrece, y sumado a eso los buenos precios. Este trabajo es el medio de subsistencia de ella y de su familia, es por ello que le pone mucho empeño a lo que hace.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, y demás tipos de verduras, con lo cual podrá surtirse y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women called “Enterprising Women” is in its 1st loan cycle with the Paraguay Foundation's Enterprising Women Program. In addition to each member's independent work, they also develop activities together to collect funds to be able to have group capital to count on. At the same time, they provide mutual help to arrive at their main objective, which is to help their families.

Jacinta is one of the members. She sells vegetables, and she tells us that its going very well. She always has good sales of the high quality products she sells, in part because of her good prices. This work is the means of subsistence for Jacinta and her family, for whom she puts forth her efforts.

Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, locotes, onions, and other types of vegetables, to resupply her stock and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old widow who has 3 children. She has operated a second-hand clothing business in Bondo town, in western Kenya, for the last fifteen years. She makes a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has applied for first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy more stocks of second-hand clothing and shoes to sell.

Her dream is to grow her business and become a leading supplier of second-hand clothes in Bondo town.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 12 to 25 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail store where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located near a busy highway. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chemicals. Her business goal is to run a big detergent-manufacturing company within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for making more soaps.

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She has operated a shoe-selling business in Bondo town, in western Kenya, for 23 years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 10,000, which she will use to buy more stocks of shoes and school bags to sell. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of shoes and school bags.

loans.name: Felisters

texts.en:
Felisters is 31 years old and married to Edward. They have 4 children. She has operated a hotel (the local term for "restaurant") for the last 3 years in Kimilili town in western Kenya. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy a freezer for the hotel. She intends to use her profits to expand the hotel to serve to more clients.

Her dream is to open other branches to increase her turnover and to be able to feed and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for her hotel (restaurant).

loans.name: Soliadrias De Tuyukua Group

texts.es:
20 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas que ven en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad que les permitirá salir adelante.
La presidenta, la señora Juana vive con su marido, ella se dedica a la artesania en ñanduti (tejido típico de Paraguay). Elabora Polleras de danza por cantidad y luego las vende. Tambien se dedica al forrado de zandalias con detalles en ñanduti. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, colores, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para tejer ñanduti y de esa forma poder seguir produciendo.
texts.en:
Twenty women from the city of Caacupé have joined together. They have the desire to succeed so that they can help their families. These women are hard workers and self-sacrificing individuals who view this program with Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity that will help them press forward.

The president, Sra. Juana, lives with her husband. She is an artisan who works with “ñanduti” (a traditional lace produced in Paraguay). Juana produces dance skirts that are of great quality and then sells them. She also decorates sandals with details made of “ñanduti”. Juana and her fellow group members engage in constant activities in order to strengthen their friendship and accomplish their goals.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy thread, dyes, needles, and other necessary supplies for making “ñanduti”. This will help her continue production.

loans.use: to buy thread, dyes, needles, and other necessary supplies.

loans.name: Osborn

texts.en:
Osborn is thirty-five years old and married to Mary; they have 3 children. He has operated a butchery in Kimilili town in western Kenya for the last five years.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy pork to sell. He will plow the profits back into the business.

His dream is to open other branches of butcheries to supplement the current branch.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of pork.

loans.name: Artesanas 3 Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cuidad de Caacupé Las Sras del comité Artesana III, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias al apoyo que esta les da por medio de su programa están saliendo adelante.
La presidenta, la señora Victorina, está casada, y tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la producción de canasta y también a su venta. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que siempre está con pedidos. Gracias a este trabajo ha podido ayudar con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma compartir los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de canastas, para que de esa forma  pueda estar surtida para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the city of Caacupé. They are “Las Señoras del Comité Artesana III” (The Women of the Artisan Committee III) and consist of hardworking individuals. The members of this group are very appreciative of Fundación Paraguaya for the support the program has given them so that they can press forward.

The president, Sra. Victorina, is married and has children. She produces and sells baskets. Victorina says that she has done very well because she always has orders. Thanks to the work she has accomplished, she has been able to help with and contribute toward the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy baskets so that she can be stocked and fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy baskets for eventual resale.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is thirty-eight years old. She is married to Richard and they have 2 children, aged 3 and 5 years. She has operated a clothing boutique in Kimilili town, in western Kenya, for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She is requesting for her first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy stocks of new clothing to sell. She will plow the anticipated profits back into her business.

Her dream is to open another boutique.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of new clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Mwandege Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid 40s, is married with six children- five of them go to school. She has been running a food vendor business for seven years now. She works from 9.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan for household expenses, school fees, bought some rice, wheat flour, charcoal and has paid back this loan successfully.  She wants a loan to open another food market in another area. Her dream is to one day be able to open a food shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwandege" which has a total of 25 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to open another food market in another area.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de variedad de frutas para ofrecer a su clientela. Teodora  es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Teodora has a fruit stand. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of fruits to offer to her customers. Teodora is married and has five children. She lives in her own home in the District of Alto Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La señora Avelina, es comerciante de botellas vacías, las cuales las reúne comprando y las vende a las empresas de reciclaje. El crédito lo solicita para aumento de capital y así poder comprar más botellas y sacar una utilidad al venderlas. Avelina es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Vive en una casa como cuidadora,  ubicada en la zona de Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a kiva y la octava vez que solicita un préstamo de Impro.
texts.en:
Sra. Avelina is a merchant who sells empty bottles. She gathers these items and sells them to recycling companies. The loan she is requesting will increase her capital so that she can buy more bottles and make some profit from selling them. Avelina is single and has two children. She lives in a house as a caretaker in the District of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that she has worked with Kiva and the eighth time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles that can be sold to recycling companies.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El señor Marco es carpintero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de 300 pies cuadrados de Madera Cedro, para un trabajo especial. Marco es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa alquilada la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda  vez que trabaja con kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a carpenter. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy 300 square feet of cedar wood for a special job. Marco is single and has no children. He lives in a rented house in the District of Alto Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cedar wood.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 30-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is one years old. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells maize flour, millet, and sorghum. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more maize. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more maize for grinding. His business goal is to venture into a new business of a cereal shop near the retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize for grinding into flour.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: La señora Ninfa es costurera, realiza todo tipo de trabajos de confección. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de telas de distinta calidad y color para ofrecer a sus clientes y realizar su trabajo. Ninfa  es casada y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y también es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en una Institución financiera.
texts.en: Ninfa is a seamstress; she makes all kinds of clothes.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric of various qualities and colors to offer her customers and to do her work.  Ninfa is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with Kiva and also the first time she’s requested a loan from a financial institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ana Verónica

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 25 años, madre soltera de un niño de 3 años. Juntos viven en el "Recinto Las Mercedes" en la parte rural de "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda su capital entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Ana se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno; compra y vende animales y también extrae la leche de las vacas para luego venderla al igual que todos los pequeños productores de la zona. Los obstáculos de esta actividad son las enfermedades que pudiese tener el ganado por lo que Ana debe estar siempre pendiente de invertir en vacunas y chequeos para sus animales. Ella desea invertir comprando más vacas ya que la demanda de leche ha incrementado. Ana piensa en tener mejores ingresos vendiendo más litros de leche y aunque esto implica una jornada de trabajo más dura está muy contenta ya que podrá dar un mejor porvenir a su hijo.

La vida para esta joven no ha sido fácil, pero tiene muchas ganas de emprender y darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, Ana es un ejemplo de madre responsable ya que sola ha sabido salir adelante y hoy gracias a un crédito estará más cerca de sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is a single mother of a 3-year old son.  They live in the Las Mercedes area, a rural part of Santo Domingo, a canton in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, one of the most densely populated of Ecuador.  It is very attractive because it has various monuments throughout its capital including the Monument to the Colorado Indian in an area known as Y del Colorado.  Santo Domingo is a privileged canton with marvelous, hard-working and entrepreneurial people who struggle tirelessly for development and progress.  They always receive tourists with open arms and they take them to see the marvels of their culture and environment.

Ana raises dairy cows.  She buys and sells them and also milks the cows to later sell it as do all the small producers of this zone.  The obstacles she finds for this business are diseases that the cows can have so Ana also needs to buy vaccines and have the animals checked.  She wants to purchase more cows since the demands for their milk is increasing.  She plans on obtaining better earnings by selling more liters of milk although this means harder days.  Nevertheless she is happy  that she can give her son a better future.

Her life is not easy but she is determined to act and give her son a better future.  Ana is an example of a responsible mother since she  has been able to get ahead on her own and now she will be closer to her goals thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, refrescos, conservas y otros productos para tiendas de barrio. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más mercadería, arroz, azucar, harina, bebida espirituosa como el Singani Casa Real, Singani San Pedro (Singani es una bebida hecha de uva) y champagne, y así poder surtir su tienda .Martha  es casada y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a kiva y la séptima vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO.
texts.en: Martha has a store where she sells groceries, soft-drinks, canned goods and other products for neighborhood stores.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, spirit beverages like Singani Casa Real and Singani San Pedro (Singani is a beverage made from grapes) and champagne to stock her store.  Martha is married and has two children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  This is the fifth time she’s worked with Kiva and the seventh time she’s asked for a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: La señora Prudencia es artesana y realiza tejidos de mantas. El crédito lo requiere para  capital de trabajo, compra de lana de vicuña para elaborar las mantas y así también ponerlas a la venta. Prudencia  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010.
texts.en: Prudencia is an artisan; she weaves blankets.  She needs the loan as working capital to buy vicuña wool to make the blankets to sell.  Prudencia is single and has a son.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  It’s the third time she’s worked with Kiva and she’s been an IMPRO client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Aurora Cantel Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación básica, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la sastrería a la confección de pantalones y camisas, inició este trabajo como operaria con una vecina de ella y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas e hilos que le servirá para confeccionar mas camisa y pantalones, espera en el futuro contar con mas capital, y la compra de otras maquinas. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la tejeduría, crianza de animales, panadería y al bordado.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Magdalena is 31 years old and completed her basic education.  She has one child who is in school.  Maria Magdalena is a seamstress who produces trousers and shirts.  She started in this line of work by working with her neighbor.  Now she has 10 years of experience.  

Maria Magdalena decided to request a loan in order to buy fabrics and thread for producing more shirts and trousers.  In the future, she hopes to have more capital so that she can buy more machines.  The other members engage in knitting, raising animals, baking bread, and embroidery.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys and sweaters.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 55 años. Vive junto a su esposo Glovio y sus dos pequeños hijos que están cursando la educación básica. Residen el recinto "Las Mercedes" ubicado en la parte rural de "Santo Domingo# que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda su capital entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Junto a su esposo, Sara se dedica a la criar animales para luego venderlos. La jornada diaria es dura ya que en el campo hay muchas actividades que requieren fuerza física. Este matrimonio ha superado muchos obstáculos entre los cuales el más importante fue la llegada de una peste que mató casi a todos sus animales; sin embargo han sabido levantarse y continuar para así poder dar a su hogar lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Sara quiere invertir en comprar pollos ya que la demanda de estos se ha incrementado; hace dos años ella obtuvo un crédito con un grupo de emprendedoras en Fundación Alternativa, quien la ha calificado como una clienta puntual, y ahora ella vuelve por su segundo crédito, esta vez el crédito lo realizará junto a su esposo.

Sara siempre ha sido una mujer que supera obstáculos, y estamos seguros de que le irá bien con esta inversión y que podrá tener mejores ingresos como lo ha planificado.
texts.en:
Sara is a 55-year old woman who lives with her husband Glovio and their two children who attend school. They live in the neighbourhood of Las Mercedes in the rural area of Santo Domingo which is a canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, one of Ecuador’s most densely populated provinces. It attracts many visitors as there are several monuments in the capital city including the Monumento al Indio Colorado. Santo Domingo is a privileged canton because of its wonderful, hardworking and enterprising people. They work tirelessly to get on in life and always welcome tourists with open arms, keen to show them their wonderful culture and local sights.

Sara and her husband raise and sell animals for a living. Their daily work is hard as in the countryside there are always lots of chores which require a great physical effort.
