Gloria’s activity is general grocery sales.  Her store is located in her home.  She sells basic staple items.  The business started two years ago with help from her spouse who had the idea and with his own capital added to a small loan managed to buy the initial products but in small amounts.  In time, it’s grown and it has led to economic stability.  Now, with the income she’s able to help her spouse with household expenses.  She plans to continue and to stock her store.

This will be MFP loan #1 so she’s hoping for your support to continue toward her objectives.  She will use the requested 800 soles to buy products at wholesale prices to stock her store and have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.es:
La señora Angelica Susana es casada, tiene 32 años, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, lleva 9 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la poya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y también de diferentes clase, hilos de mish y alta seda, espera en el futuro su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Angélica Susana, 32, is married and went to all six grades of elementary school; she has three children who are attending school.  She weaves traditional fabrics and has nine years’ experience.  Her husband helps her out economically.  She’s asking for a loan to buy thread in assorted colors and of different kinds, ‘hilos de mish’ [rayon thread with a silk-like appearance] and silk.  She hopes her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la agricultura , esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic Atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que con el préstamo anterior lograr sembrar mas áreas de piña , logrando también abonar gran parte del cultivo ya establecido ; lo cual obtuvo resultado muy satisfactorios y lo mejor de todo es q ahora el tiene tres mozo a su cargo lo que lo llena de mucha alegría ya que si no hubiese sido beneficiado con Kiva el no podría llevar el pan de cada día a su familia junto a sus trabajadores , los sueños mas grande son  poder terminar su vivienda para gozar de un mejor bienestar .
texts.en: Arturo is a humble farmer in the Ticuantepe zone with his family.  His plan for his family is to improve their quality of life.  He’s been a farmer for a long time.  He’s very happy with the support he gets from Afodenic through Kiva funds because he was able to use the prior loan to plant larger areas of  pineapple crops as well as to fertilize a great part of the established plants which led to very satisfactory results.  The best of all is that he now has employed three helpers which fills him with happiness because if he hadn’t been benefited by a Kiva loan he would not be able to provide daily bread for his family and his workers.  His greatest dream is to be able to finish his house to enjoy greater wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Venicia Dionisia

texts.es:
Venicia sigue laborando como conserje y sigue con su pequeño negocio de alquiler de cuarto. solo ha terminado de apoyar  a sus hijos, hoy en dia separada de su esposo, atraves de sus ahorros logro hacer los cuartos que hoy en dia, son parte de sus ingresos.
Hara mantenimiento en su techo, al cambiar laminas de zinc y compra de perlines, para mejorar su condicion, ya que esta con muchos ollos el zinc, por falta de mantenimiento, ya que sus prestamo lo ha invertido en dar mejoras a los cuartos de alquiler. Pero hoy es necesario, ya que no quiere pasar otro invierno en las misma condiciones
texts.en:
Venicia is still working as a caretaker and still has her business renting out rooms.  She’s done supporting her children and she’s separated from her husband.  With her savings she managed to build the rooms she has now which are part of her income.

She will be doing some roof maintenance replacing the metal sheets and she’ll buy purlines to improve its condition since the metal has many holes in it due to lack of maintenance since she’s used her loans to invest in improvements for her rental rooms.  But, now it’s necessary because she does not want to spend another winter under the same conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to repair the roof.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
Con 54 años de edad, originario de San Marcos una comunidad ubica en las afueras de Estelí, es Joaquín, el tiene 25 años trabajando como agricultor, el siembra hortalizas y granos básicos, es casado tiene 3 hijos de 7,14 y 18 años de edad respectivamente. Cuando inicio en la agricultura fue en una pedazo de tierra que le asigno el gobierno desde entonces trabajo en su parcela donde orgullosamente con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo duro se gana el alimento para sus hijos. El viaja hasta  la ciudad capital Managua para vender su producción buscando como venderlo a un buen precio e el mercado donde la competencia es intensa pero el lucha hasta conseguirlo. Pero regresa a su casa con la satisfacción de haber conseguido un buen precio por sus productos. 
El solicita el préstamo para sembrar 2 manzanas de cebollas. Este le ayudara a comprar los insumos necesarios para sacar una producción de muy buena calidad. El tiene como proyecto próximo una vez finalizado la siembra de cebolla sembrar una manzana de Tomates.
texts.en:
At the age of 54 and in San Marcos, a community located in the outskirts of Estelí, Joaquín has been working as a farmer for 25 years.  He grows vegetables and basic grains.  He’s married and has three children who are 7, 14 and 18 years of age respectively.

When he started out farming it was on a piece of land the government assigned to him and since then he’s worked his parcel proudly with much effort and hard work generating food for his children.  He travels to the city of Managua to sell his crops looking to sell them at a good price in the market where competition is intense but he strives until he accomplishes it.  He returns home with the satisfaction of having gotten a good price for his products.

He is asking for the loan to plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of onions.  The loan will help him buy the necessary supplies to produce a good quality harvest.  His next project for when he finishes planting the onions is to plant a manzana of tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Juan Benigno

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre  trabajador  que tiene una pequeña peluquería. Comenzó con esta actividad  porque trabajo en una peluquería y decidió tener su propio negocio para mejorar sus ingresos. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. Sus actividades en la peluquería son  peinados, cortes, tinturados etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para la peluquería como sillas, mesas, tijeras etc.
texts.en: Juan is a hardworking man who has a small barber shop.  He started this activity because he had worked in a barber shop and he decided to have a business of his own to improve his income.  He works every day from 8am until 6pm.  His barber services include hair styling, haircuts, hair coloring, etc.  He has many hopes for his business and that is why he wants to use the loan to buy tools for the shop like chairs, tables, scissors, etc.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and scissors.

loans.name: Petita Angelica

texts.es:
Petita Angelica tiene 29 años  es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad en el Recinto Caimito en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla  LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Petita Angelica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace siete años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos  para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar una moto.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Petita Angélica, 29, is single and lives with her two children who are 16 and 12 years of age in Recinto Caimito in Ventanas Canton.

The “La Verdad Nos Hará Libres” (The Truth Shall Make Us Free) communal bank is located in Recinto Caimito 1 belonging to Ventanas Canton.  It is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Petita Angélica has been farming corn for seven years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them there too.

The loan she asked for is to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea and liquids for her corn crops.  The loan has helped her increase income for her family’s wellbeing.  Her dream is to buy a motorcycle.  In her free time she enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her corn crops.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Elda tiene 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser alegre y sociable. Está casada con José quien es topógrafo de profesión. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos. La actividad que realiza Elda es la de comerciante, en la compra y venta de frutas y alimentos al por mayor, como plátanos, granos y gallinas en los puertos y en los mercados de su localidad. Lleva realizando éste negocio desde hace 5 años, pagando a estibadores ocasionales para la carga de los productos.
Le agrada su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien y está acostumbrada a levantarse desde temprano para realizar sus compras. Con las ganancias puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y darse algunos gustos. Ahora viendo las ganancias que le deja, tiene planes de invertir en otro negocio como una bodega en su casa en donde le ayudaría a atender sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, esta contenta de contar con un poyo financiero para alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería pero en mayor cantidad para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elda is 47 years old. She is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead, as well as to be happy and friendly. She is married to José, who is a topographer. They live together in their own house with their three children. Elda works as a salesperson in the buying and selling of fruit and wholesale foods, like plantains, grains, and chickens, both door-to-door and in the markets in her area. She has been doing this job for five years, sometimes paying stevedores for the shipping of her products.

She appreciates her business because she knows it well and is used to getting up early to make her purchases. With the earnings she can help her husband with household expenses and give him some things he likes. Right now, seeing the money she is making, she has plans to invest in another business, a small shop in her house where her grown children would help her. 

This will be her first loan with the MFP institution. She is happy to have this financial support to be able to achieve her goals. With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles, she will buy wholesale merchandise so that she can get better profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit, grains, and chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Aquiles Jose

texts.es:
Don Aquiles, continua, laborando como guarda de seguridad, para el la mejoras a su casa, han sido su objetivo, en donde ha venido realizando con financiamiento. 
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, comprara puerta de madera, y hara portones de hierro, lo que dara mas seguridad, ya que las que tiene estan en malas condiciones por viejas. Como planes a futuro es poder comenzar hacer su pequeño muro, el cual sera posible trabajando de la mano con la institucion.
texts.en:
Aquiles keeps on working as a security guard. To him improving his house his is main goal, a for this reason he has requested his first loan.
Today, with this new loan, he will buy a wooden door and will have iron gates made: this will grant him better security, as the ones he now has are old and in bad conditions. His plan for the future is to be able to start building a small wall, something that will be possible by working together with the institution.

loans.use: To buy wooden doors and to have iron gates made in order to make his house safer.

loans.name: Micaela Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Micaela Jesus es casada, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tricotado de hilos, ella inicio como operaria lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases para mejora su producción de tricotado, espera tener mejor capital.
texts.en:
Micaela Jesus, 38, is married and has 5 children with 4 in school.  She has a knitting business that she began 3 years ago with the financial support of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy different types of thread to increase her knitting production.  She wants to have better working capital.

loans.use: to buy thread and dye for thread

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , desde hace muchos años de dedica a fabricar pan artesanal , ella con el primer crédito logro mejorar parte de la infraestructura del negocio y dejo una parte para invertirlo en hacer leche agria y tortilla para aprovechar la mañana y obtener un ingreso adicional ya que el pan lo hacen por las tardes para venderlo calientito y fresco , esto a provocado que las ventas se incrementen pero el mayor obstáculo es no tener suficiente recursos económicos para brindarle una mejor demanda a sus clientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sus sueños es poder comprar algún día un horno industrial para ya no tener que quemarse tanto con la leña del horno artesanal.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. For many years she has made a living making artisanal bread. 

With her first loan she was able to improve her business' infrastructure. She left part of it aside to invest in making leche agria [a fermented milk product served for breakfast] and tortillas to take advantage of the morning hours and make an additional income since she makes her bread in the afternoons in order to sell it hot and fresh. This has helped to increase her income however, the biggest obstacle is not having enough financial resources to increase demand from her customers. 

Her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions and her dream is to one day be able to buy an industrial oven so that she doesn't end up burning so much bread as she does in the artisanal oven.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Nely Antonia

texts.es:
Nely Antonia, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en una aldea de El Níspero Santa Bárbara junto a sus 3 hijos de 3,8 y 11 años de edad.
Nely trabajo por un tiempo en una maquila, y hace 1 año y medio estableció su propio negocio con sus propios esfuerzos, ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, huevos, pollo, productos de limpieza, pan etc.  Debido a que los vecinos tenían que caminar larga distancia hasta llegar a la otra pulpería, ella aprovecho la oportunidad de invertir en una pulpería. Poco a poco a reinvertido sus ganancias para incrementar el inventario. Y para mantener surtido este negocio ha solicitado un préstamo de L.15,000.00 para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, arroz, manteca, pan, harina, y otros.
Su meta es mantener este negocio surtido, hacerlo crecer más y lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nely Antonia is 32 years old. She lives in the village of El Níspero, Santa Bárbara together with her three children who are three, eight, and eleven years old. Nely worked for a bit in a factory and one and a half years ago she started her own business through her own efforts. 

She sells basic needs products like staple grains. sugar, rice, lard, flour, eggs, chicken, cleaning products, bread, etc. Due to the fact that the neighbors have to walk a long distance to reach the other small grocery store, she took advantage of the chance to invest in her own small grocery store. Little by little she is reinvesting her profits into expanding her inventory. 

To keep the business supplied she is requesting a loan for 15,000.00 lempiras to buy staple grains, sugar, rice, lard, bread flour and other things. Her goal is to keep the store supplied, make it grow, and make sure that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to supply her store with basic products like staple grains, rice, sugar, bread, sodas, lard, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Elsy Yanira

texts.es:
Elsy, de nuevo solicita otro préstamo con el propósito de invertirlo en su negocio de ropa para comprar más mercadería como: blusas, faldas, pantalones y lociones para damas y caballeros debido  a la época de diciembre es cuando más se vende y podrá obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron, porque mejoro su situación económica que tenia anteriormente y su familia sigue estable.
texts.en:
Elsy is requesting another loan with the idea to invest in her clothing company. She will buy more merchandise like: blouses, skirts, pants and lotions for women and men. Given that December is the time when she makes the most sales and will be able to make a better income. 

The previous loans helped her as she improved her previous financial situation and her family is stable now.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and lotions for women and men.

loans.name: Walter Emmanuel

texts.es: Walter, nuevamente se ha decidido a un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de invertir en la siembra de granos básicos y comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesitan como: abono, herbicidas, semilla,  a si podrá obtener buenas cosechas en esta nueva siembra que iniciara. Él considera que los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron porque logro mejorar la forma de vida de su familia y logro que sus cosechas fueran abundantes.
texts.en: Walter has just decided on a new loan due to the need to invest in the harvest of basic grains seeds and to buy agricultural supplies that he needs like: manure, herbicide, and seeds so that he will be able to have a good crop in the upcoming planting season. He believes that the prior loans helped him because he was able to improve his family’s quality of life and he had an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de nuevo solicita un préstamo debido a la buena atención que les brida nuestra institución y por la necesidad de mejorar en su granja, comprara tres cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado esperando darlos a buen precio.
Los prestamos anteriores le beneficiaron porque le permitió crecer en su negocio y mejoraron mucho sus ingresos ya actualmente están en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María has just asked for a loan due to the good service provided by our institution as well as the need to improve her farm. She will buy three pigs to raise and later sell in the market, and she is hoping to sell them at a good price. 

Previous loans benefited her because they allowed her to grow her business and greatly increase her income. Now her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Ybette

texts.es:
Ybette, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchos deseos de superación. Está casada con Ramón quien es agricultor, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 6 años de edad a los que quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ybette es la venta de abarrotes  de primera necesidad para lo cual cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, donde vende también frutas frescas, para esto se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige a los mercados donde compra las frutas más frescas de los productores y los lleva a su bodega para venderlos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Tiene más de 2 años dedicandose a éste negocio, por lo que ha logrado ganarse de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cerca de sus hijos, además de brindarle una ocupación, y generarle un ingreso económico para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar así como  la educación de sus hijos. Además con las ganancias que ha obtenido, tiene planes de continuar e incluso ampliar el negocio, adquiriendo más mercadería para su bodega. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega, como productos de primera necesidad a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ybette is 43 years old and is a hardworking and earnest woman with many dreams of success. She is married to Ramon who is a farmer. She lives with her husband and their two children aged 18 and 6 year old who they love very much. They live in their own home. 

Ybette sells groceries and has a store in her home where she also sells fresh fruit. To do this she gets up very early and goes to the markets where she buys the freshest fruit from the suppliers, and she brings it back to her store to sell to her customers who are mostly her neighbors. She’s been in this business for more than 2 years since she has established a friendly and cordial relationship with her customers. She enjoys her business because it allows her to be at home close to her kids, it has given her a job, and it brings in money to help her husband with the household costs as well as their children’s education.  Furthermore, with the income she has gotten, she plans to continue and expand the business, acquiring more merchandise for her store. 

This will be her first loan with MFP. She’s happy for the opportunity to have a line of credit, and so she promises to comply with the terms of the agreement in order to have a good credit history and get more loans in the future. 

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store, like buying basic products in bulk to have a better profit margin.

loans.use: buy a greater variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, quiere otro préstamo para invertirlo de nuevo en la panadería para elaborar: pan francés, pan dulce, budín y para eso tiene que tener la materia prima necesaria como: harina, levadura, azúcar y manteca y podrá mejorar en sus ganancias.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho porque pudo ganar más clientes y económicamente a mejorado mucho en la panaderia.
texts.en:
José wants another loan to reinvest in his bakery to make french bread, pan dulce [sweet breads], and pudding. To do this he has to have the basic ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, and lard and he will improve his income.

The previous loans helped him a lot as he was able to attain more customers and the bakery has improved a lot financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, and lard.

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista, es una humilde agricultora de la zona de Masaya, junto a su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a los  trabajos de campos, especialmente al cultivo de yuca, la gran dificultad que se le presenta es no contar con recurso necesarios para iniciar la siembra ya que en la cosecha del año pasado sufrió perdida total del mismo;  ya que afecto los enormes chubascos de agua llevandose todo el cultivo,  logrando cancelar su crédito con mucha dificultad y desasiéndose de una pequeña vaca que tenia la cual le generaba leche para su familia pero la necesidad de quedar bien la obligo a venderla ya que dice que en un futuro la podar reponer , el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar madera para yuca , fertilizantes e insumos , mano de obra  y otros suministros para realizar una buena siembra y tener producto de calidad .
texts.en: Evarista is a humble farmer in the area of Masaya. For several years, with her family she has worked in the fields. She has grown mostly yucca. The big problem she has had is not having the resources necessary to start the crops since she suffered a total loss of last year's crop.The heavy rain storms really affected her and swept away the whole crop. She was able to pay off her loan with much difficulty and by selling a small cow she had that generated milk for her family. The need to pay her debt resulted in her having to sell it, since she says that in the future she can replace it. She needs the loan to buy wood for the yucca as well as fertilizer, materials, labor and other supplies to have a good crop an have quality product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Juan Antonio es soltero, tienen 23 años de edad, esta graduado de maestro de deportes, se dedica a jugar fútbol en una federación deportiva, lleva ya 5 años con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para apertura una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, va a compra aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, dulces, cereales, azúcar, etc. Espera su negocio sea rentable y recupere una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is single. He is 23 years old and has a degree in sports. He plays football in a sports league. He has had this job for 5 years.

He decided to ask for a loan to open a store that sells products for daily use. He is going to buy carbonated water, juices, candies, snacks, cereal, sugar, etc. He hopes his business will be profitable and that he will make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy store products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, solicita otro préstamo porque quiere aprovechar la época de fin de año para incrementar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos y comprar más frutas frescas como: mango, jocotes, jícamas, sandia, papaya, para ofrecerles a los clientes variedad.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque las ventas mejoraron cada día, las condiciones económicas son favorables para su familia.
texts.en: María is asking for another loan because she wants to take advantage of the end of year season to increase sales and earn higher income and buy more fruit like: mangoes, jocotes [red mombin], jicama, watermelon and papayas to offer a greater variety to her customers.  Previous loans helped her because sales improved daily and the economic conditions are favorable for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, corn, chicken, beans and instant coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin, necesita de nuevo otro préstamo para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, Él alqulara la tierra para cosechar frijoles y maíz y comprara los fertilizantes como: herbicidas, abono, y semilla al tener todo lo necesario podrá lograr una mejor cosecha este año, que sean mejores puesto que venderá una parte al mercado y otra parte  lo dejara para su familia.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho pues pudo mantener a su familia y mejorar mucho en sus ingresos; agradece mucho a nuestra institución por brindarle ayuda y quiere seguir trabajando para tener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Edwin is applying for a loan to support his farming business.  He grows beans and maize on land that he rents and he will use part of the loan to buy supplies--herbicides, manure and seeds--that he needs for his next crop.  He will sell part of the crop and keep the rest for his family.
The money that he borrowed before helped him to increase his income and better support his family.  He is grateful for the help that he's received in the past and will work hard to maintain a good credit history.

loans.use: to pay rent on farm and buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
Santos Pablo es una persona muy trabajadora de 27 años de edad, casado con tres hijos de 2, 3 y 5 años de edad, vive en Manatapa  Intibucá.
Santos desde pequeño ha trabajado la agricultura junto a su padre, actualmente tiene sus propios cultivos, desde hace diez años produce papa, maíz y frijoles. La zona es apta para estos cultivos. Tiene más de una manzana cultivada y la producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicito es para invertir en compra de semilla de papa y abonos, con esto él espera ampliar su nivel de producción y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Santos Pablo is a very hardworking 27-year-old.  He’s married and has three children who are 2, 3 and 5 years old.  He lives in Manatapa, Intibucá.  Since childhood, Santos has worked in farming alongside his father.  Currently, he has his own fields and has been growing potatoes, corn and beans for the last ten years.  The zone is appropriate for those types of crops.  He has more than a manzana [Central American unit of land measure] under cultivation and he sells his crops in the local market.  The loan he requested is to buy potato seeds and manure that he hopes to use to expand his production level and obtain more profits.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and manure.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de oficio comerciante vive en Pueblo Municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene 2 hijos uno de 28 años que ya se graduó y el otro tiene 18 años que esta estudiando su tercer año de la universidad. El se dedica a la venta de refrescos de manera ambulante. El inicio con este negocio con esfuerzos propios  a la edad de 49 años de edad antes se dedicaba a la agricultura pero vio que con el negocio de venta de refrescos le generaba ganancias mas rápido así que decidió dedicarse a la venta de este producto, su esposa lo ayuda en sus ratos libres ya que ella trabaja como enfermera. El realizo crédito para compra de frutas, azúcar, pajillas, bolsas plásticas para hacer sus refrescos de sabores naturales. Donde todos los días con su humilde termo y su bicicleta sale a vender por las calles de Pueblo Nuevo calmando la sed de sus clientes que lo esperan. El quiere segur prosperando su negocio, llegar a terminar la construcción que tiene de hacer un inodoro(baño) y hacer cuartos para sus hijos pues su vivienda es muy humilde y tiene las condiciones necesarias para vivir.
texts.en: Carlos lives in Esteli and owns his own business.  He is married with 2 children: one, 28, has already graduated and the other, 18, is in his third year at university.  Carlos works as a street vendor.  He started the business, selling fruit drinks, when he was 49 years old.  He was a farmer before but decided to sell fruit drinks instead because he saw that he could make more money.  His wife, a nurse, helps him in her spare time.  Carlos will use this loan to buy supplies--fruit, sugar, straws, plastic bags--that he needs for the business.  He goes out every day on his bike, with his beat-up cooler, to sell in the streets of the town, quenching the thirst of his waiting customers.  He wants to finish a bathroom that he's building and add rooms to his small house so that his children have their own space.  He wants his business to prosper so that he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his fruit drink business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina, tiene 52 años es madre soltera con 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua.  Agustina es una mujer llena de talento para los negocios, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace 4 años. Nos comenta que cuando su esposo falleció tuvo que hacer frente a las necesidades del hogar, por ello emprendió éste negocio. En la actualidad le va muy bien gracias a la buenas ventas que realiza, también se debe a la poca competencia que tiene, generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su hija mayor quien le ayuda en la atención al cliente. Ella en un futuro desea ampliar su negocio incrementar más productos como vender comida rápida y la preparación de postres y con el tiempo tener su fuente de soda.
Este es su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de más productos.
texts.en:
Agustina, 52, is a single mother with 4 children.  They live together in a house that Agustina owns in Canayre, a small town in the Llochegua district.  Agustina is a talented businesswoman.  She has operated a business selling beverages for 4 years.  She tells us that she started the business when her husband died and she needed an income to keep the family going.  The business is a success, she says, and generates a good income.  There's not much competition for the business in the neighborhood and Agustina can rely on her oldest daughter to help her with customers.  She wants to expand the business and sell prepared foods, including deserts, and even add a soda fountain.  
This is Agustina's third MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the 2,000 new soles loan to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 52 años, casado con Felicitas de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Andrés es un hombre de buenos principios, nso comenta que cuando empezó en este negocio al principio no se ganaba mucho pero poco a poco fue ganando clientela. Actualmente tiene buenos ingresos gracias al esfuerzo que le puso en la atención al cliente. Es así que se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, y recibir a sus clientes que desde muy temprano comprarn lo necesario para preparar sus alimento y luego enrumbrar a sus campor agrícolas que es donde trabajan la gran mayoría. En el futuro piensa surtir su tienda, con prendas de vestir y generarse más ingresos. Asimismo Andres se dedica a la agricultura donde cultiva cacao y otros productos que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de más productos para el expendio en su tienda.
texts.en:
Andrés is 52 years old.  He is married to Felicitas, 46.  They have two children together and live in their own house in the heart of Canayre in the district of Llochegua.  Andrés is a principled man. 

He tells us that in the beginning when he started this business he didn't earn much, but, little by little, he increased his clientele.  Currently, he has a good income thanks to the effort that he put into customer service.  This is why he gets up very early to open his store for his customers.  Early in the morning they buy what they need to prepare food and then they head to the fields where the vast majority of them work.   

In the future he plans to stock his store with clothing to generate more income.  Andrés also works as a farmer, growing cocoa and other products that are in high demand.  

This will be his third loan with MFP and he is committed to paying off his loan on time.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] he will buy more products to sell in his store.

loans.use: buy more products to stock his store.

loans.name: Georgina Mercedez

texts.es:
Georgina Mercedez es casada, tienen 40 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educación, tiene 6 hijos 4  de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de perfumes, cremas, lociones, pinturas faciales,shampoo, etc, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un crédito que lo utiliza para la compra de mas mercadería y mejorar sus venta y ganancias. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Georgina Mercedez is married, 40 years old, and has a third grade education.  She has 6 children, 4 of whom are studying in school.  She has a business selling perfumes, creams, lotions, face paint, shampoo, etc.  She has 10 years of experience, and she relies on the support of her husband, who works as a bricklayer.  

She requests a loan so that she can purchase more merchandise and improve her sales and earnings.  In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey, 45, is a single mother of two children and lives in Dongkor Commune, Phnom Penh City. She works on the sewing staff for a garment factory and normally acquires her payment monthly. In addition, her two children are working for another garment factory to satisfy their daily needs. 

Due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle for commuting to work, this family has great expenses for transportation fees. Mrs. Mey would like to reduce these expenses by looking for some funds from HKL to buy a motorcycle for the entire family’s use. 

In the future, Mrs. Mey intends to open a seamstress shop for her daughter in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the entire family’s use.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 60 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernardita has been raising pigs for 7 years and also earns additional income from feeds retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been in her business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,250 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Khom, 58, is married and resides with her husband, her mother, and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory as a cleaner for over a year. Her husband is a gardener. Both of her children are employed at the garment factory as well. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Khom is requesting for a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she would be able to go to work on time and save some on her transportation expense to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Mr. Pom, age 37 and a father of 4 children, has been residing in Takhmao town together with his family. He is a construction foreman who is in charge of and watches over a group of workers at the building site. He typically yields approximately $6 per day through this business. Besides his main outdoor work, he also devotes some spare time to be a fisherman to generate additional income.

With the loan he has applied for from HKL, Pom will buy construction supplies to support his business. His future goal is to upgrade his skills and become the owner of construction projects and to build a construction team by himself.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years. Her husband has been a broom trader for over six years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. In order to improve her family living condition, Toch is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to run a new business:  selling Khmer traditional medicine in other provinces. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business of selling traditional medicine, build a new house and support her children to study to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry Khmer traditional medicine to sell in other provinces

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for over six years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory. Because the factory is far away from home, Sophy requests a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her youngest child to study to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en: Kourn, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years and have extensive experience and are successful in their career. She is involved in growing rice to generate income for the family. Additionally, her husband is a construction worker. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Kourn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to run a new business: purchasing motorbike spare parts to sell at home to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money to run a bigger motorbike spare parts shop to make more profit. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts to sell at home

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak, age 56, a local farmer, has taken a photo at a side of her thatched house, many parts of which are broken putting her family in a hard situation. Prak immediately needs to reconstruct her house and she wants to make it stronger. She has already bought some of the building materials for the construction. With this loan amount, she will buy additional timber to complete the whole building. Mrs. Prak would like to say thanks to all lenders for the kindly help and for the quick response. Nowadays, she lives with her husband and 4 single children in Baray district.

loans.use: to buy additional timber to complete her house

loans.name: Ganesa Jaya Group

texts.en:
Masripah is a mother of four children aged 22, 16, 10 and 4, two of whom are still at school. She has run a grocery store in her home for five years. She sells sugar, oil, rice, eggs and children's snacks in her store. Her business is running smoothly and she is able to contribute to the family income and help her husband, who is an employee, provide food for the family and pay school fees. 
Now Masripah wants to increase the volume of rice in her store. For this reason she is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund Indonesia. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and be an agent. 
The other group members sell nasi uduk (an Indonesian dish), coffee, cosmetics and snacks.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Oeurng

texts.en: Oeurng, 59, is widowed and resides with her son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 10 years and is successful in her career. Her son is a Khmer traditional musician. Due to the difficulty in travelling, Oeurng is requesting for a loan of USD 300 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to where he plays traditional music in other ceremonies. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to where he plays traditional music

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Menerva owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Menerva has operated this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month doing this type of business.

In 2010, Menerva joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gurragchaa

texts.en: Gurragchaa wanted to renovate his ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The things he would like to renovate include the floor, cover, and other small parts. Because these parts have been becoming old and out of usage. Also heat-loss happens through the  undressed warm cover of ger. It increases the usage of coal fuel which raises extremely poisonous air all around of city. During last few years it has been one of biggest and essential issue in Mongolians. After the making the insulation to his ger, coal usage will be decreased notably as he planned. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase some parts of ger such as warm cover for his home renovation. It will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase some parts of ger such as warm cover for his home renovation.

loans.name: Melde

texts.en:
Melde is from Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Melde owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling charcoal in the local community. Melde has been in her business for four years and earns 4,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Melde joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melde is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn, 60, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over 20 years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. She is involved in growing rice. Additionally, she is a tailor. Her son is a construction worker. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Rorn is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase a plot of farming land to grow more agricultural crops. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a kitchen and support her youngest child to study until he/she gets a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farming land to grow more agricultural crops

loans.name: Alma Group

texts.en:
Siti is 45 years old, married and has four children (she is pictured wearing a pink shirt and a veil). She opened an internet cafe in 2009 near to her house. The business is going well. From her income, she can contribute to the household income and help her husband, who works as a laborer in a car workshop, to pay the children's school fees. 
Sometimes Siti experiences problems if there is any error with the internet connection. She now wants to buy more keyboards, headsets and modems. That is why she is requesting her third loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund Indonesia. 
In the future, she wants to add more personal computers to the cafe to increase the number from six to ten. She also hopes her children get a good education, finish university and find a good job.
The other group members will use their part of the loan to improve their businesses – beauty salons and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to buy keyboards, headsets and modems.

loans.name: Magsar

texts.en:
Magsar is a 39-year-old carpenter who lives with his family in the outer ger district without the basic infrastructure of Ulaabaatar city, Mongolia. His spouse is a doctor for a local kindergarten, and their son and daughter both attend secondary school. 

Previously, his family was living in a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Now the family lives in a new small house, which they built. In Mongolia, the Winter is very cold, and he needs to install a heating system on his house. So he is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase support materials for setting up the heating system. 

He is also a very trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.

loans.use: to set up a heating system for his house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Teresita buys and peddles home products like blades in boxes, threads, needles, and pins. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of home products to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for home products to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Marife used her last loan to purchase snack items to sell such as hot cakes (pancakes) and banana cue (bananas fried in hot oil, coated with sugar). Her business is progressing, and she is now taking a new loan to purchase cooking ingredients for making snack foods. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients for making snack foods.

loans.name: Journadel

texts.en:
Journadel is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Journadel has a retail shop that sells used clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of used clothing for resale.
Journadel is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 42, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been running a business renting out cottages on Bati Lake for over five years and have made a successful business. Her two sons are employed as construction workers. 
In order to improve her family's economy, Channy is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell at a profitable price when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to breed more cattle to generate more profit to support the family and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 53 years old. She is married, with two adult children. The family resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marina used her last loan to purchase manure and a young mango tree of another type. Marina's business is progressing and she is taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with ten children. 

Patricia has a retail shop that sells vegetables like gabi or root crops, spring onions and eggplants. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Patricia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Patricia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nenita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.
 
Lucila has a retail shop that sells sacks of charcoal and firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood.

Lucila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Juanito has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juanito is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Thelma is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Thelma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, catching and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Thelma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bersatu Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Khusnul is a widow. She does not have any children. She has had a grocery store since 2008. Her business is going well. But she does not have a complete inventory in her store. Now she also sewing clothes as ordered. 

She is taking out her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy sewing supplies such as thread and needles and she also wants to add more goods to her store. From her income she can buy daily food and pay rent. She likes sewing and she likes having income from her store. In the future, she hopes she can open a boutique.

Other group members are selling eggs, "ketoprak" (an Indonesian dish) and "gado-gado" (an Indonesian dish of  vegetables mixed with peanut sauce.)

loans.use: to pay for sewing supplies such as thread and needles and to pay for more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Pors

texts.en:
Pors, 53, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agriculture for over six years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their business. 

Pors is involved in growing rice. Her children are construction workers. In order to improve her family's finances, Pors is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill. This will allow her to generate more income to support the family.

In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol, 23, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years. Her husband is a construction worker. Additionally, she and her husband grow agricultural crops. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Chanthol is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she would be able to get to work on time and save some money on her transportation expense. 

In the future, Chanthol would like to raise pigs to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her child to study for a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a trailer and a large metal container to start providing a water transportation service to the people in her commune.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 41, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over six years. Her husband has been involved in growing rice for over 10 years and is successful in his career. Because the factory is far away from home, Ry is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she plans to grow rice in the dry season, build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to meet the needs of the family.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 47, is married, and resides with her husband, her mother and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a weaver. Additionally, she is a rice farmer and raises chickens to generate more income. Her husband is a carpenter who manufactures furniture to sell to generate income for the family. Two of her children are employed at the Christian school. 

Mao is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase wood for her husband to manufacture more furniture to sell to his clients so as to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and purchase more farming land to grow rice. Moreover, she plans to build a kitchen, a bathroom and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her husband to manufacture more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Seab, 53, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she is involved in fattening up pigs to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. Her husband is a nylon rope vendor. Her twenty-year-old daughter is a garment worker. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Seab is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more nylon rope for her husband to sell to his clients. In the future, she would like to invest more money to expand her husband's business, build a bathroom and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more nylon rope for her husband to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis, 29, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a wholesaler who sells gas at home and also distributes to her clients around the province. Additionally, she has a rental house which generates more income for the family. Her husband runs a phone shop and Internet shop in Phnom Penh city. 

Due to the increasing demand for gas in the province, Malis is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more gas to distribute to her clients. This way she will make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her business in order to become a gas distributor who directly purchases gas from the company. Moreover, she plans to buy a flat for her husband to run his phone shop and Internet shop in Phnom Penh city and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to distribute to her clients.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea is a loving father of six children. He permanently lives in Baray district and is in the business of fishing as well as selling firewood. From these businesses, he’s able to earn income of $3.50 per day to cover his daily need. 

As shown in the photo, Chea’s house is old and it sometimes suffers from the weather. Consequently, it doesn’t provide a comfortable living for the family, especially in the rainy season. Chea wants to fix his house and replace some parts that are unusable. This is his second loan from HKL and he will use it to purchase the necessary building materials to fix his house. He’s very happy and grateful to all lenders who continually help his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to fix his house.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 20, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Pov has been running a business selling traditional medicines for over two years. He has extensive experience and success in his business. He also takes the medicines to other provinces around the country to sell them there. His wife helps him run the business. 

In order to improve his business, Pov is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in order to buy more more traditional medicines to sell and make more profit. In the future, he would like to purchase a new car to transport his medicines to sell around the country. Moreover, he plans to build a new concrete house.

loans.use: to buy more traditional medicines to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 27, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over three years, and has extensive experience and successes in her career. She is involved in growing rice and raising poultry to sell to generate income for the family. Her husband helps her run the business. 

Sopheap's husband has an old motorbike that he uses to sell grilled eggs around the village. Because the old motorbike breaks down too often, Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can easily carry his grilled eggs to sell. By doing so, her family's finances will be improved. In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to for her husband to carry grilled eggs to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer aged 35. He is married with four children aged between 15 and 4 years. He has been in farming for four years and currently produces tea which he sells to the local market.

James has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He wants to venture into dairy farming to compliment the profits he makes from tea which take a long time to materialise. He adds dairy income will enable him meet his family's daily needs and educate the children.

James says he is aware of the challenges of dairy farming like rampant diseases and fluctuation in milk prices but hopes to surmount them. He is glad Juhudi Kilimo enables farmers to acquire assets like dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is taking another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of blouses, suits and Kikois (cotton fabric) for sale. With the additional income from the business, she intends to renovate her house and provide better education for her children. 

Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing her with financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Phach

texts.en:
Phach, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over 20 years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening cattle both to use and to sell for a profit. 

Her husband is a tuk tuk (motorcycle taxi) driver. As the tuk tuk is old, Phach is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new tuk tuk for her husband to use as a taxi to generate more income to support the family. By doing so, her family's finances will be improved. In the future, she would like to purchase five sows to raise and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk for her husband to use as a taxi.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged 38 and is married with two children aged eight and three. He has been in poultry farming for six years and sells his eggs to the local market. In addition to farming, he runs a motorcycle transport business within the local market. His currently employs one farmhand.

John has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him boost his poultry farming business. He says he has seen the potential in poultry farming and wants to exploit the opportunity fast and supply bigger markets within the region. He adds he will use the income to educate his children.

John says he has focus to repay the loan and acquire more in future.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business buying poultry to sell for over ten years. She has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. Her husband has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years. He is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle to use as well as to sell for a profitable price. Additionally, he runs a motor taxi when he is free from his farming work. 

In order to improve her family's standard of living, Sokha has requested a loan of USD 600 to purchase chickens and ducks to run a poultry farm. By doing this she aims to generate more income to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to rent a store at the market to sell chickens and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks to run a poultry farm.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en: Nory, 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a garment worker for over three years. Her husband has been a palm juice and palm sugar vendor for over 15 years. In order to improve her family livelihood, Nory is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new kitchen and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 29, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a printing house in Phnom Penh city for over three years. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Vanna is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she could save some money from her transportation expense to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a small printing house at home, build a new wooden house and support her child to higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 27, is married and resides with her husband, four children and a sister in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for over five years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in breeding pigs and producing palm sugar. Her husband helps her run the business. Additionally, he is a palm tree climber who climbs to get palm juice for his wife to produce palm sugar. 

In order to improve her palm sugar production to run smoothly, Ny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a cart to carry firewood to cook palm juice to produce palm sugar and to purchase a long ladder for her husband to climb palm trees. In the future, she would like to expand her palm sugar production, build a new wooden house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to carry firewood and to purchase a long ladder for her husband to climb palm trees.

loans.name: Simoun

texts.en: Simoun, 45, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been a religious tool producer for over 10 years. Her husband has been a drama actor and singer for over 15 years. Additionally, he is a singer in a music band in a restaurant as well as wedding ceremonies. Two of her children are also singers in the band. In order to improve her family livelihood, Simoun is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase steel to produce open-sheds in the music ban for rental. In the future, she would like to build a new concrete house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase steel to produce open-sheds in the music ban for rental

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a resident and a farmer in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya and has been in poultry farming for over four years. His eggs and milk products are sold to the local market. He is married with one child, age four. He currently employs one farmhand.

Paul has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation pipes. He says this will create his water supply that will make his farming easier and generate more income. He says he wants to expand his farming and make it his core business and main source of income for family upkeep.

He, however, laments the exorbitant charges from poultry feed dealers.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with one school-aged child. She owns and operates a gardening business venture. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Chork

texts.en:
Chork, 68, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He and his wife have been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years, and have extensive experience and are successful in their career. 

Two of his children are garment workers. Due to the factory being far away from home, Chork is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for his children to commute to work. By doing so, his children can get to work on time and save some money from their transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, he would like to build a new concrete house and support his youngest child to higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his children to commute to work.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam is 51 years old and is in the business of planting rice and vegetable crops. Presently she lives in Takhmao town with her husband and 2 single children, while the other 5 children are already married and live independently.
 
This is her second loan from HKL and Kiva, and she will use it to buy 10 bags of organic fertilizers and pesticides to keep her crops growing well. In the future, she aims to raise piglets in her backyard to increase her household income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides to keep her crops growing well.

loans.name: Dadanne

texts.en: Dadanne, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruits vendor. Her husband is a truck driver who carries chickens and ducks to sell at the market. In order to expand her business, Dadanne is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fruits to sell in order to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she plans to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in order to make more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is from Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Ryan is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Ryan owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab). Ryan has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Ryan is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to cover the cost of maintenance and repair of his motorcycle.

In 2010, Ryan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and have an additional motorcycle for business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 53 years old.

Elvira has a rice mill business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Elvira has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
Dellie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her bamboo weaving business.

Dellie has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for bamboo weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & vegetables.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 26 years old and married with one child currently going to school. Jennylyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jennylyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jennylyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, candy, sardines, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future Jennylyn would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lutgarda is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lutgarda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Lutgarda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lutgarda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lutgarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with three children. Elma is 43 years old and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2008, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elma wants to build house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marissa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as spices, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

In the future Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business of repairing watches and clocks at the market. Four of her children are employed. Two are garment workers and two more are the staff in a food store. 

Thy requests a loan of USD 500 to purchase more watch-repairing tools for her husband to have enough tools to use in his reparation service. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more watch repairing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district, Chy, 21, is the mother of a young child. 

She grows crops on rented farmland to generate income for her livelihood. Her husband always assists her in the business. Together, they are able to earn approximately $5 each day to cover their daily expenses.

Chy would like to take out a loan from HKL to pay the rented farmland, on which she will plant potatoes and some types of vegetable crops in a new cycle. This loan will enable her to sustain her farming business. In the future, Chy intends to buy and own a few pieces of farmland herself to increase in her income.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.
